      82             : // If simdType is one of the SIMD types suported by Ion, set mirType to the
      83             : // corresponding MIRType, and return true.
      84             : //
      85             : // If simdType is not suported by Ion, return false.
      86             : static inline MOZ_MUST_USE
      87           0 : bool MaybeSimdTypeToMIRType(SimdType type, MIRType* mirType)
      88             : {
      89           0 :     switch (type) {
      90             :       case SimdType::Uint32x4:
      91           0 :       case SimdType::Int32x4:     *mirType = MIRType::Int32x4;   return true;

      93           0 :       case SimdType::Int16x8:     *mirType = MIRType::Int16x8;   return true;

      95           0 :       case SimdType::Int8x16:     *mirType = MIRType::Int8x16;   return true;

      99           0 :       case SimdType::Bool8x16:    *mirType = MIRType::Bool8x16;  return true;
     100             :       default:                    return false;
     101             :     }
     102             : }
     103             : 
     104             : // Convert a SimdType to the corresponding MIRType, or crash.

     112           0 :     JS_ALWAYS_TRUE(MaybeSimdTypeToMIRType(type, &ret));
     113           0 :     return ret;
     114             : }

     116             : static inline
     117           0 : SimdType MIRTypeToSimdType(MIRType type)

     120             :       case MIRType::Int32x4:   return SimdType::Int32x4;
     121           0 :       case MIRType::Int16x8:   return SimdType::Int16x8;
     122           0 :       case MIRType::Int8x16:   return SimdType::Int8x16;
     123           0 :       case MIRType::Float32x4: return SimdType::Float32x4;
     124           0 :       case MIRType::Bool32x4:  return SimdType::Bool32x4;
     125           0 :       case MIRType::Bool16x8:  return SimdType::Bool16x8;
     126           0 :       case MIRType::Bool8x16:  return SimdType::Bool8x16;
     127             :       default:                break;
     128             :     }
     129           0 :     MOZ_CRASH("unhandled MIRType");
     130             : }
     131             : 
     132             : // Get the boolean MIRType with the same shape as type.
     133             : static inline
     134           0 : MIRType MIRTypeToBooleanSimdType(MIRType type)
     135             : {
     136           0 :     return SimdTypeToMIRType(GetBooleanSimdType(MIRTypeToSimdType(type)));
     137             : }
     138             : 
     139             : #define MIR_FLAG_LIST(_)                                                        \
     140             :     _(InWorklist)                                                               \
     141             :     _(EmittedAtUses)                                                            \
     142             :     _(Commutative)                                                              \
     143             :     _(Movable)       /* Allow passes like LICM to move this instruction */      \
     144             :     _(Lowered)       /* (Debug only) has a virtual register */                  \
     145             :     _(Guard)         /* Not removable if uses == 0 */                           \
     146             :                                                                                 \
     147             :     /* Flag an instruction to be considered as a Guard if the instructions
     148             :      * bails out on some inputs.
     149             :      *
     150             :      * Some optimizations can replace an instruction, and leave its operands
     151             :      * unused. When the type information of the operand got used as a
     152             :      * predicate of the transformation, then we have to flag the operands as
     153             :      * GuardRangeBailouts.
     154             :      *
     155             :      * This flag prevents further optimization of instructions, which
     156             :      * might remove the run-time checks (bailout conditions) used as a
     157             :      * predicate of the previous transformation.
     158             :      */                                                                         \
     159             :     _(GuardRangeBailouts)                                                       \
     160             :                                                                                 \
     161             :     /* Keep the flagged instruction in resume points and do not substitute this
     162             :      * instruction by an UndefinedValue. This might be used by call inlining
     163             :      * when a function argument is not used by the inlined instructions.
     164             :      */                                                                         \
     165             :     _(ImplicitlyUsed)                                                           \
     166             :                                                                                 \
     167             :     /* The instruction has been marked dead for lazy removal from resume
     168             :      * points.
     169             :      */                                                                         \
     170             :     _(Unused)                                                                   \
     171             :                                                                                 \
     172             :     /* When a branch is removed, the uses of multiple instructions are removed.
     173             :      * The removal of branches is based on hypotheses.  These hypotheses might
     174             :      * fail, in which case we need to bailout from the current code.
     175             :      *
     176             :      * When we implement a destructive optimization, we need to consider the
     177             :      * failing cases, and consider the fact that we might resume the execution
     178             :      * into a branch which was removed from the compiler.  As such, a
     179             :      * destructive optimization need to take into acount removed branches.
     180             :      *
     181             :      * In order to let destructive optimizations know about removed branches, we
     182             :      * have to annotate instructions with the UseRemoved flag.  This flag
     183             :      * annotates instruction which were used in removed branches.
     184             :      */                                                                         \
     185             :     _(UseRemoved)                                                               \
     186             :                                                                                 \
     187             :     /* Marks if the current instruction should go to the bailout paths instead
     188             :      * of producing code as part of the control flow.  This flag can only be set
     189             :      * on instructions which are only used by ResumePoint or by other flagged
     190             :      * instructions.
     191             :      */                                                                         \
     192             :     _(RecoveredOnBailout)                                                       \
     193             :                                                                                 \
     194             :     /* Some instructions might represent an object, but the memory of these
     195             :      * objects might be incomplete if we have not recovered all the stores which
     196             :      * were supposed to happen before. This flag is used to annotate
     197             :      * instructions which might return a pointer to a memory area which is not
     198             :      * yet fully initialized. This flag is used to ensure that stores are
     199             :      * executed before returning the value.
     200             :      */                                                                         \
     201             :     _(IncompleteObject)                                                         \
     202             :                                                                                 \
     203             :     /* The current instruction got discarded from the MIR Graph. This is useful
     204             :      * when we want to iterate over resume points and instructions, while
     205             :      * handling instructions which are discarded without reporting to the
     206             :      * iterator.
     207             :      */                                                                         \
     208             :     _(Discarded)
     209             :

     220             : // Represents a use of a node.
     221             : class MUse : public TempObject, public InlineListNode<MUse>
     222             : {
     223             :     // Grant access to setProducerUnchecked.
     224             :     friend class MDefinition;
     225             :     friend class MPhi;
     226             : 
     227             :     MDefinition* producer_; // MDefinition that is being used.
     228             :     MNode* consumer_;       // The node that is using this operand.
     229             : 
     230             :     // Low-level unchecked edit method for replaceAllUsesWith and
     231             :     // MPhi::removeOperand. This doesn't update use lists!
     232             :     // replaceAllUsesWith and MPhi::removeOperand do that manually.
     233             :     void setProducerUnchecked(MDefinition* producer) {
     234             :         MOZ_ASSERT(consumer_);
     235             :         MOZ_ASSERT(producer_);
     236             :         MOZ_ASSERT(producer);
     237           1 :         producer_ = producer;
     238             :     }
     239             : 
     240             :   public:
     241             :     // Default constructor for use in vectors.
     242             :     MUse()
     243           1 :       : producer_(nullptr), consumer_(nullptr)
     244             :     { }
     245             : 
     246             :     // Move constructor for use in vectors. When an MUse is moved, it stays
     247             :     // in its containing use list.
     248             :     MUse(MUse&& other)
     249             :       : InlineListNode<MUse>(mozilla::Move(other)),
     250           1 :         producer_(other.producer_), consumer_(other.consumer_)
     251             :     { }
     252             : 
     253             :     // Construct an MUse initialized with |producer| and |consumer|.
     254             :     MUse(MDefinition* producer, MNode* consumer)
     255           1 :     {
     256             :         initUnchecked(producer, consumer);
     257             :     }
     258             : 
     259             :     // Set this use, which was previously clear.
     260             :     inline void init(MDefinition* producer, MNode* consumer);
     261             :     // Like init, but works even when the use contains uninitialized data.
     262             :     inline void initUnchecked(MDefinition* producer, MNode* consumer);
     263             :     // Like initUnchecked, but set the producer to nullptr.
     264             :     inline void initUncheckedWithoutProducer(MNode* consumer);
     265             :     // Set this use, which was not previously clear.
     266             :     inline void replaceProducer(MDefinition* producer);
     267             :     // Clear this use.
     268             :     inline void releaseProducer();
     269             : 
     270             :     MDefinition* producer() const {
     271             :         MOZ_ASSERT(producer_ != nullptr);
     272             :         return producer_;
     273             :     }
     274             :     bool hasProducer() const {
     275             :         return producer_ != nullptr;
     276             :     }
     277             :     MNode* consumer() const {
     278             :         MOZ_ASSERT(consumer_ != nullptr);
     279             :         return consumer_;
     280             :     }
     281             : 
     282             : #ifdef DEBUG
     283             :     // Return the operand index of this MUse in its consumer. This is DEBUG-only
     284             :     // as normal code should instead to call indexOf on the casted consumer
     285             :     // directly, to allow it to be devirtualized and inlined.
     286             :     size_t index() const;
     287             : #endif
     288             : };
     289             : 
     290             : typedef InlineList<MUse>::iterator MUseIterator;
     291             : 
     292             : // A node is an entry in the MIR graph. It has two kinds:
     293             : //   MInstruction: an instruction which appears in the IR stream.
     294             : //   MResumePoint: a list of instructions that correspond to the state of the
     295             : //                 interpreter/Baseline stack.
     296             : //
     297             : // Nodes can hold references to MDefinitions. Each MDefinition has a list of
     298             : // nodes holding such a reference (its use chain).
     299             : class MNode : public TempObject
     300             : {
     301             :   protected:
     302             :     MBasicBlock* block_;    // Containing basic block.
     303             : 
     304             :   public:
     305             :     enum Kind {
     306             :         Definition,
     307             :         ResumePoint
     308             :     };
     309             : 
     310             :     MNode()
     311           1 :       : block_(nullptr)
     312             :     { }
     313             : 
     314             :     explicit MNode(MBasicBlock* block)
     315           1 :       : block_(block)
     316             :     { }
     317             : 
     318             :     virtual Kind kind() const = 0;
     319             : 
     320             :     // Returns the definition at a given operand.
     321             :     virtual MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const = 0;
     322             :     virtual size_t numOperands() const = 0;
     323             :     virtual size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const = 0;
     324             : 
     325             :     bool isDefinition() const {
     326           1 :         return kind() == Definition;
     327             :     }
     328             :     bool isResumePoint() const {
     329           1 :         return kind() == ResumePoint;
     330             :     }
     331             :     MBasicBlock* block() const {
     332             :         return block_;
     333             :     }
     334             :     MBasicBlock* caller() const;
     335             : 
     336             :     // Sets an already set operand, updating use information. If you're looking
     337             :     // for setOperand, this is probably what you want.
     338             :     virtual void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) = 0;
     339             : 
     340             :     // Resets the operand to an uninitialized state, breaking the link
     341             :     // with the previous operand's producer.
     342           1 :     void releaseOperand(size_t index) {
     343           1 :         getUseFor(index)->releaseProducer();
     344           1 :     }
     345             :     bool hasOperand(size_t index) const {
     346           1 :         return getUseFor(index)->hasProducer();
     347             :     }
     348             : 
     349             :     inline MDefinition* toDefinition();
     350             :     inline MResumePoint* toResumePoint();
     351             : 
     352             :     virtual MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const;
     353             : 
     354             :     virtual void dump(GenericPrinter& out) const = 0;
     355             :     virtual void dump() const = 0;
     356             : 
     357             :   protected:
     358             :     // Need visibility on getUseFor to avoid O(n^2) complexity.
     359             :     friend void AssertBasicGraphCoherency(MIRGraph& graph, bool force);
     360             : 
     361             :     // Gets the MUse corresponding to given operand.
     362             :     virtual MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) = 0;
     363             :     virtual const MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) const = 0;
     364             : };
     365             : 
     366             : class AliasSet {
     367             :   private:
     368             :     uint32_t flags_;
     369             : 
     370             :   public:
     371             :     enum Flag {
     372             :         None_             = 0,
     373             :         ObjectFields      = 1 << 0, // shape, class, slots, length etc.
     374             :         Element           = 1 << 1, // A Value member of obj->elements or
     375             :                                     // a typed object.
     376             :         UnboxedElement    = 1 << 2, // An unboxed scalar or reference member of
     377             :                                     // a typed array, typed object, or unboxed
     378             :                                     // object.
     379             :         DynamicSlot       = 1 << 3, // A Value member of obj->slots.
     380             :         FixedSlot         = 1 << 4, // A Value member of obj->fixedSlots().
     381             :         DOMProperty       = 1 << 5, // A DOM property
     382             :         FrameArgument     = 1 << 6, // An argument kept on the stack frame
     383             :         WasmGlobalVar     = 1 << 7, // An asm.js/wasm global var
     384             :         WasmHeap          = 1 << 8, // An asm.js/wasm heap load
     385             :         WasmHeapMeta      = 1 << 9, // The asm.js/wasm heap base pointer and
     386             :                                     // bounds check limit, in Tls.
     387             :         TypedArrayLength  = 1 << 10,// A typed array's length
     388             :         Last              = TypedArrayLength,
     389             :         Any               = Last | (Last - 1),
     390             : 
     391             :         NumCategories     = 11,
     392             : 
     393             :         // Indicates load or store.
     394             :         Store_            = 1 << 31
     395             :     };
     396             : 
     397             :     static_assert((1 << NumCategories) - 1 == Any,
     398             :                   "NumCategories must include all flags present in Any");
     399             : 
     400             :     explicit AliasSet(uint32_t flags)
     401             :       : flags_(flags)
     402             :     {
     403             :     }
     404             : 
     405             :   public:
     406             :     static const char* Name(size_t flag);
     407             : 
     408             :     inline bool isNone() const {
     409             :         return flags_ == None_;
     410             :     }
     411             :     uint32_t flags() const {
     412           1 :         return flags_ & Any;
     413             :     }
     414             :     inline bool isStore() const {
     415           1 :         return !!(flags_ & Store_);
     416             :     }
     417             :     inline bool isLoad() const {
     418           1 :         return !isStore() && !isNone();
     419             :     }
     420             :     inline AliasSet operator |(const AliasSet& other) const {
     421             :         return AliasSet(flags_ | other.flags_);
     422             :     }
     423             :     inline AliasSet operator&(const AliasSet& other) const {
     424           0 :         return AliasSet(flags_ & other.flags_);
     425             :     }
     426             :     static AliasSet None() {
     427             :         return AliasSet(None_);
     428             :     }
     429             :     static AliasSet Load(uint32_t flags) {
     430             :         MOZ_ASSERT(flags && !(flags & Store_));
     431             :         return AliasSet(flags);
     432             :     }
     433             :     static AliasSet Store(uint32_t flags) {
     434             :         MOZ_ASSERT(flags && !(flags & Store_));
     435           1 :         return AliasSet(flags | Store_);
     436             :     }
     437             :     static uint32_t BoxedOrUnboxedElements(JSValueType type) {
     438           1 :         return (type == JSVAL_TYPE_MAGIC) ? Element : UnboxedElement;
     439             :     }
     440             : };

     465             : 
     466             : // An MDefinition is an SSA name.
     467             : class MDefinition : public MNode
     468             : {
     469             :     friend class MBasicBlock;
     470             : 
     471             :   public:
     472             :     enum Opcode {
     473             : #   define DEFINE_OPCODES(op) Op_##op,
     474             :         MIR_OPCODE_LIST(DEFINE_OPCODES)
     475             : #   undef DEFINE_OPCODES
     476             :         Op_Invalid
     477             :     };
     478             : 
     479             :   private:
     480             :     InlineList<MUse> uses_;        // Use chain.
     481             :     uint32_t id_;                  // Instruction ID, which after block re-ordering
     482             :                                    // is sorted within a basic block.
     483             :     uint32_t flags_;               // Bit flags.
     484             :     Range* range_;                 // Any computed range for this def.
     485             :     MIRType resultType_;           // Representation of result type.
     486             :     TemporaryTypeSet* resultTypeSet_; // Optional refinement of the result type.
     487             :     union {
     488             :         MDefinition* loadDependency_;      // Implicit dependency (store, call, etc.) of this
     489             :         StoreDependency* storeDependency_; // instruction. Used by alias analysis, GVN and LICM.
     490             :         uint32_t virtualRegister_; // Used by lowering to map definitions to virtual registers.
     491             :     };
     492             : 
     493             :     // Track bailouts by storing the current pc in MIR instruction. Also used
     494             :     // for profiling and keeping track of what the last known pc was.
     495             :     const BytecodeSite* trackedSite_;
     496             : 
     497             :   private:
     498             :     enum Flag {
     499             :         None = 0,
     500             : #   define DEFINE_FLAG(flag) flag,
     501             :         MIR_FLAG_LIST(DEFINE_FLAG)
     502             : #   undef DEFINE_FLAG
     503             :         Total
     504             :     };
     505             : 
     506             :     bool hasFlags(uint32_t flags) const {
     507           1 :         return (flags_ & flags) == flags;
     508             :     }
     509             :     void removeFlags(uint32_t flags) {
     510           1 :         flags_ &= ~flags;
     511             :     }
     512             :     void setFlags(uint32_t flags) {
     513           1 :         flags_ |= flags;
     514             :     }
     515             : 
     516             :   protected:
     517             :     void setBlock(MBasicBlock* block) {
     518           1 :         block_ = block;
     519             :     }
     520             : 
     521             :     static HashNumber addU32ToHash(HashNumber hash, uint32_t data);
     522             : 
     523             :   public:
     524             :     MDefinition()
     525             :       : id_(0),
     526             :         flags_(0),
     527             :         range_(nullptr),
     528             :         resultType_(MIRType::None),
     529             :         resultTypeSet_(nullptr),
     530             :         loadDependency_(nullptr),
     531           1 :         trackedSite_(nullptr)
     532             :     { }
     533             : 
     534             :     // Copying a definition leaves the list of uses and the block empty.
     535             :     explicit MDefinition(const MDefinition& other)
     536             :       : id_(0),
     537             :         flags_(other.flags_),
     538             :         range_(other.range_),
     539             :         resultType_(other.resultType_),
     540             :         resultTypeSet_(other.resultTypeSet_),
     541             :         loadDependency_(other.loadDependency_),
     542           1 :         trackedSite_(other.trackedSite_)
     543             :     { }
     544             : 
     545             :     virtual Opcode op() const = 0;

     548             :

     557             :     // For LICM.
     558           1 :     virtual bool neverHoist() const { return false; }

     560             :     // Also for LICM. Test whether this definition is likely to be a call, which
     561             :     // would clobber all or many of the floating-point registers, such that
     562             :     // hoisting floating-point constants out of containing loops isn't likely to
     563             :     // be worthwhile.
     564           1 :     virtual bool possiblyCalls() const { return false; }
     565             : 
     566             :     void setTrackedSite(const BytecodeSite* site) {
     567             :         MOZ_ASSERT(site);

     569             :     }
     570             :     const BytecodeSite* trackedSite() const {
     571             :         return trackedSite_;

     574           1 :         return trackedSite_ ? trackedSite_->pc() : nullptr;

     581             :                ? trackedSite_->optimizations()

     584             : 
     585             :     JSScript* profilerLeaveScript() const {
     586             :         return trackedTree()->outermostCaller()->script();
     587             :     }
     588             : 
     589           1 :     jsbytecode* profilerLeavePc() const {
     590             :         // If this is in a top-level function, use the pc directly.
     591           1 :         if (trackedTree()->isOutermostCaller())
     592           1 :             return trackedPc();
     593             : 
     594             :         // Walk up the InlineScriptTree chain to find the top-most callPC
     595           1 :         InlineScriptTree* curTree = trackedTree();
     596           1 :         InlineScriptTree* callerTree = curTree->caller();
     597           1 :         while (!callerTree->isOutermostCaller()) {
     598             :             curTree = callerTree;
     599             :             callerTree = curTree->caller();
     600             :         }
     601             : 
     602             :         // Return the callPc of the topmost inlined script.
     603           1 :         return curTree->callerPc();
     604             :     }
     605             : 
     606             :     // Return the range of this value, *before* any bailout checks. Contrast
     607             :     // this with the type() method, and the Range constructor which takes an
     608             :     // MDefinition*, which describe the value *after* any bailout checks.
     609             :     //
     610             :     // Warning: Range analysis is removing the bit-operations such as '| 0' at
     611             :     // the end of the transformations. Using this function to analyse any
     612             :     // operands after the truncate phase of the range analysis will lead to
     613             :     // errors. Instead, one should define the collectRangeInfoPreTrunc() to set
     614             :     // the right set of flags which are dependent on the range of the inputs.
     615             :     Range* range() const {
     616             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() != MIRType::None);
     617             :         return range_;
     618             :     }
     619             :     void setRange(Range* range) {
     620             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() != MIRType::None);
     621           1 :         range_ = range;
     622             :     }
     623             : 
     624             :     virtual HashNumber valueHash() const;
     625           1 :     virtual bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const {
     626           1 :         return false;
     627             :     }
     628             :     bool congruentIfOperandsEqual(const MDefinition* ins) const;
     629             :     virtual MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc);
     630             :     virtual void analyzeEdgeCasesForward();
     631             :     virtual void analyzeEdgeCasesBackward();
     632             : 
     633             :     // When a floating-point value is used by nodes which would prefer to
     634             :     // recieve integer inputs, we may be able to help by computing our result
     635             :     // into an integer directly.
     636             :     //
     637             :     // A value can be truncated in 4 differents ways:
     638             :     //   1. Ignore Infinities (x / 0 --> 0).
     639             :     //   2. Ignore overflow (INT_MIN / -1 == (INT_MAX + 1) --> INT_MIN)
     640             :     //   3. Ignore negative zeros. (-0 --> 0)
     641             :     //   4. Ignore remainder. (3 / 4 --> 0)
     642             :     //
     643             :     // Indirect truncation is used to represent that we are interested in the
     644             :     // truncated result, but only if it can safely flow into operations which
     645             :     // are computed modulo 2^32, such as (2) and (3). Infinities are not safe,
     646             :     // as they would have absorbed other math operations. Remainders are not
     647             :     // safe, as fractions can be scaled up by multiplication.
     648             :     //
     649             :     // Division is a particularly interesting node here because it covers all 4
     650             :     // cases even when its own operands are integers.
     651             :     //
     652             :     // Note that these enum values are ordered from least value-modifying to
     653             :     // most value-modifying, and code relies on this ordering.
     654             :     enum TruncateKind {
     655             :         // No correction.
     656             :         NoTruncate = 0,
     657             :         // An integer is desired, but we can't skip bailout checks.
     658             :         TruncateAfterBailouts = 1,
     659             :         // The value will be truncated after some arithmetic (see above).
     660             :         IndirectTruncate = 2,
     661             :         // Direct and infallible truncation to int32.
     662             :         Truncate = 3
     663             :     };
     664             : 
     665             :     static const char * TruncateKindString(TruncateKind kind) {
     666             :         switch(kind) {
     667             :           case NoTruncate:
     668             :             return "NoTruncate";
     669             :           case TruncateAfterBailouts:
     670             :             return "TruncateAfterBailouts";
     671             :           case IndirectTruncate:
     672             :             return "IndirectTruncate";
     673             :           case Truncate:
     674             :             return "Truncate";
     675             :           default:
     676             :             MOZ_CRASH("Unknown truncate kind.");
     677             :         }
     678             :     }
     679             : 
     680             :     // |needTruncation| records the truncation kind of the results, such that it
     681             :     // can be used to truncate the operands of this instruction.  If
     682             :     // |needTruncation| function returns true, then the |truncate| function is
     683             :     // called on the same instruction to mutate the instruction, such as
     684             :     // updating the return type, the range and the specialization of the
     685             :     // instruction.
     686             :     virtual bool needTruncation(TruncateKind kind);
     687             :     virtual void truncate();
     688             : 
     689             :     // Determine what kind of truncate this node prefers for the operand at the
     690             :     // given index.
     691             :     virtual TruncateKind operandTruncateKind(size_t index) const;
     692             : 
     693             :     // Compute an absolute or symbolic range for the value of this node.
     694           1 :     virtual void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) {
     695           1 :     }
     696             : 
     697             :     // Collect information from the pre-truncated ranges.
     698           1 :     virtual void collectRangeInfoPreTrunc() {
     699           1 :     }
     700             : 
     701           1 :     MNode::Kind kind() const override {
     702           1 :         return MNode::Definition;
     703             :     }
     704             : 
     705             :     uint32_t id() const {
     706             :         MOZ_ASSERT(block_);
     707             :         return id_;
     708             :     }
     709             :     void setId(uint32_t id) {
     710           1 :         id_ = id;
     711             :     }
     712             : 
     713             : #define FLAG_ACCESSOR(flag) \
     714             :     bool is##flag() const {\
     715             :         return hasFlags(1 << flag);\

     722             :         MOZ_ASSERT(hasFlags(1 << flag));\

     725             :     void set##flag##Unchecked() {\
     726             :         setFlags(1 << flag);\
     727             :     } \
     728             :     void setNot##flag##Unchecked() {\
     729             :         removeFlags(1 << flag);\
     730             :     }
     731             :

     735             :     // Return the type of this value. This may be speculative, and enforced

     982             : 
     983             : // An MUseDefIterator walks over uses in a definition, skipping any use that is
     984             : // not a definition. Items from the use list must not be deleted during
     985             : // iteration.
     986             : class MUseDefIterator
     987             : {
     988             :     const MDefinition* def_;
     989             :     MUseIterator current_;
     990             : 
     991           1 :     MUseIterator search(MUseIterator start) {
     992           1 :         MUseIterator i(start);
     993           1 :         for (; i != def_->usesEnd(); i++) {
     994           1 :             if (i->consumer()->isDefinition())
     995           1 :                 return i;
     996             :         }
     997           1 :         return def_->usesEnd();
     998             :     }
     999             : 
    1000             :   public:
    1001             :     explicit MUseDefIterator(const MDefinition* def)
    1002             :       : def_(def),
    1003           1 :         current_(search(def->usesBegin()))
    1004             :     { }
    1005             : 
    1006             :     explicit operator bool() const {
    1007           1 :         return current_ != def_->usesEnd();
    1008             :     }
    1009           1 :     MUseDefIterator operator ++() {
    1010             :         MOZ_ASSERT(current_ != def_->usesEnd());
    1011           1 :         ++current_;
    1012           1 :         current_ = search(current_);
    1013           1 :         return *this;
    1014             :     }
    1015             :     MUseDefIterator operator ++(int) {
    1016           1 :         MUseDefIterator old(*this);
    1017           1 :         operator++();
    1018             :         return old;
    1019             :     }
    1020             :     MUse* use() const {
    1021           1 :         return *current_;
    1022             :     }
    1023             :     MDefinition* def() const {
    1024           1 :         return current_->consumer()->toDefinition();
    1025             :     }
    1026             : };
    1027             : 
    1028             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1029             : bool
    1030             : IonCompilationCanUseNurseryPointers();
    1031             : #endif
    1032             : 
    1033             : // Helper class to check that GC pointers embedded in MIR instructions are in
    1034             : // in the nursery only when the store buffer has been marked as needing to
    1035             : // cancel all ion compilations. Otherwise, off-thread Ion compilation and
    1036             : // nursery GCs can happen in parallel, so it's invalid to store pointers to
    1037             : // nursery things. There's no need to root these pointers, as GC is suppressed
    1038             : // during compilation and off-thread compilations are canceled on major GCs.
    1039             : template <typename T>
    1040             : class CompilerGCPointer
    1041             : {
    1042             :     js::gc::Cell* ptr_;
    1043             : 
    1044             :   public:
    1045             :     explicit CompilerGCPointer(T ptr)
    1046           1 :       : ptr_(ptr)
    1047             :     {
    1048             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(IsInsideNursery(ptr), IonCompilationCanUseNurseryPointers());
    1049             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(!CurrentThreadIsIonCompiling(), TlsContext.get()->suppressGC);
    1050             :     }
    1051             : 
    1052           1 :     operator T() const { return static_cast<T>(ptr_); }
    1053           1 :     T operator->() const { return static_cast<T>(ptr_); }
    1054             : 
    1055             :   private:
    1056             :     CompilerGCPointer() = delete;
    1057             :     CompilerGCPointer(const CompilerGCPointer<T>&) = delete;
    1058             :     CompilerGCPointer<T>& operator=(const CompilerGCPointer<T>&) = delete;
    1059             : };
    1060             : 
    1061             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<JSObject*> CompilerObject;
    1062             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<NativeObject*> CompilerNativeObject;
    1063             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<JSFunction*> CompilerFunction;
    1064             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<JSScript*> CompilerScript;
    1065             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<PropertyName*> CompilerPropertyName;
    1066             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<Shape*> CompilerShape;
    1067             : typedef CompilerGCPointer<ObjectGroup*> CompilerObjectGroup;
    1068             : 
    1069             : class MRootList : public TempObject
    1070             : {
    1071             :   public:
    1072             :     using RootVector = Vector<void*, 0, JitAllocPolicy>;
    1073             : 
    1074             :   private:
    1075             :     mozilla::EnumeratedArray<JS::RootKind, JS::RootKind::Limit, mozilla::Maybe<RootVector>> roots_;
    1076             : 
    1077             :     MRootList(const MRootList&) = delete;
    1078             :     void operator=(const MRootList&) = delete;
    1079             : 
    1080             :   public:
    1081             :     explicit MRootList(TempAllocator& alloc);
    1082             : 
    1083             :     void trace(JSTracer* trc);
    1084             : 
    1085             :     template <typename T>
    1086           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool append(T ptr) {
    1087           1 :         if (ptr)
    1088           1 :             return roots_[JS::MapTypeToRootKind<T>::kind]->append(ptr);
    1089             :         return true;
    1090             :     }
    1091             : 
    1092             :     template <typename T>
    1093             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool append(const CompilerGCPointer<T>& ptr) {
    1094           1 :         return append(static_cast<T>(ptr));
    1095             :     }
    1096           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool append(const ReceiverGuard& guard) {
    1097           1 :         return append(guard.group) && append(guard.shape);
    1098             :     }
    1099             : };
    1100             : 
    1101             : // An instruction is an SSA name that is inserted into a basic block's IR
    1102             : // stream.
    1103             : class MInstruction
    1104             :   : public MDefinition,
    1105             :     public InlineListNode<MInstruction>
    1106             : {
    1107             :     MResumePoint* resumePoint_;
    1108             : 
    1109             :   protected:
    1110             :     // All MInstructions are using the "MFoo::New(alloc)" notation instead of
    1111             :     // the TempObject new operator. This code redefines the new operator as
    1112             :     // protected, and delegates to the TempObject new operator. Thus, the
    1113             :     // following code prevents calls to "new(alloc) MFoo" outside the MFoo
    1114             :     // members.
    1115             :     inline void* operator new(size_t nbytes, TempAllocator::Fallible view) throw() {
    1116             :         return TempObject::operator new(nbytes, view);
    1117             :     }
    1118             :     inline void* operator new(size_t nbytes, TempAllocator& alloc) {
    1119             :         return TempObject::operator new(nbytes, alloc);
    1120             :     }
    1121             :     template <class T>
    1122             :     inline void* operator new(size_t nbytes, T* pos) {
    1123             :         return TempObject::operator new(nbytes, pos);
    1124             :     }
    1125             : 
    1126             :   public:
    1127             :     MInstruction()
    1128           1 :       : resumePoint_(nullptr)
    1129             :     { }
    1130             : 
    1131             :     // Copying an instruction leaves the block and resume point as empty.
    1132             :     explicit MInstruction(const MInstruction& other)
    1133             :       : MDefinition(other),
    1134           1 :         resumePoint_(nullptr)
    1135             :     { }
    1136             : 
    1137             :     // Convenient function used for replacing a load by the value of the store
    1138             :     // if the types are match, and boxing the value if they do not match.
    1139             :     MDefinition* foldsToStore(TempAllocator& alloc);
    1140             : 
    1141             :     void setResumePoint(MResumePoint* resumePoint);
    1142             : 
    1143             :     // Used to transfer the resume point to the rewritten instruction.
    1144             :     void stealResumePoint(MInstruction* ins);
    1145             :     void moveResumePointAsEntry();
    1146             :     void clearResumePoint();
    1147             :     MResumePoint* resumePoint() const {
    1148             :         return resumePoint_;
    1149             :     }
    1150             : 
    1151             :     // For instructions which can be cloned with new inputs, with all other
    1152             :     // information being the same. clone() implementations do not need to worry
    1153             :     // about cloning generic MInstruction/MDefinition state like flags and
    1154             :     // resume points.
    1155           0 :     virtual bool canClone() const {
    1156           0 :         return false;
    1157             :     }
    1158           0 :     virtual MInstruction* clone(TempAllocator& alloc, const MDefinitionVector& inputs) const {
    1159           0 :         MOZ_CRASH();
    1160             :     }
    1161             : 
    1162             :     // MIR instructions containing GC pointers should override this to append
    1163             :     // these pointers to the root list.
    1164           1 :     virtual bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const {
    1165           1 :         return true;
    1166             :     }
    1167             : 
    1168             :     // Instructions needing to hook into type analysis should return a
    1169             :     // TypePolicy.
    1170             :     virtual TypePolicy* typePolicy() = 0;
    1171             :     virtual MIRType typePolicySpecialization() = 0;
    1172             : };
    1173             : 
    1174             : #define INSTRUCTION_HEADER_WITHOUT_TYPEPOLICY(opcode)                       \
    1175             :     static const Opcode classOpcode = MDefinition::Op_##opcode;             \
    1176             :     using MThisOpcode = M##opcode;                                          \
    1177             :     Opcode op() const override {                                            \
    1178             :         return classOpcode;                                                 \
    1179             :     }                                                                       \
    1180             :     const char* opName() const override {                                   \
    1181             :         return #opcode;                                                     \
    1182             :     }                                                                       \
    1183             :     void accept(MDefinitionVisitor* visitor) override {                     \
    1184             :         visitor->visit##opcode(this);                                       \
    1185             :     }
    1186             : 
    1187             : #define INSTRUCTION_HEADER(opcode)                                          \
    1188             :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER_WITHOUT_TYPEPOLICY(opcode)                           \
    1189             :     virtual TypePolicy* typePolicy() override;                              \
    1190             :     virtual MIRType typePolicySpecialization() override;
    1191             : 
    1192             : #define ALLOW_CLONE(typename)                                               \
    1193             :     bool canClone() const override {                                        \
    1194             :         return true;                                                        \
    1195             :     }                                                                       \
    1196             :     MInstruction* clone(TempAllocator& alloc,                               \
    1197             :                         const MDefinitionVector& inputs) const override {   \
    1198             :         MInstruction* res = new(alloc) typename(*this);                     \
    1199             :         for (size_t i = 0; i < numOperands(); i++)                          \
    1200             :             res->replaceOperand(i, inputs[i]);                              \
    1201             :         return res;                                                         \
    1202             :     }
    1203             : 
    1204             : // Adds MFoo::New functions which are mirroring the arguments of the
    1205             : // constructors. Opcodes which are using this macro can be called with a
    1206             : // TempAllocator, or the fallible version of the TempAllocator.
    1207             : #define TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS                                                \
    1208             :     template <typename... Args>                                             \
    1209             :     static MThisOpcode* New(TempAllocator& alloc, Args&&... args) {         \
    1210             :         return new(alloc) MThisOpcode(mozilla::Forward<Args>(args)...);     \
    1211             :     }                                                                       \
    1212             :     template <typename... Args>                                             \
    1213             :     static MThisOpcode* New(TempAllocator::Fallible alloc, Args&&... args)  \
    1214             :     {                                                                       \
    1215             :         return new(alloc) MThisOpcode(mozilla::Forward<Args>(args)...);     \
    1216             :     }
    1217             : 
    1218             : 
    1219             : // These macros are used as a syntactic sugar for writting getOperand
    1220             : // accessors. They are meant to be used in the body of MIR Instructions as
    1221             : // follows:
    1222             : //
    1223             : //   public:
    1224             : //     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Foo)
    1225             : //     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, lhs), (1, rhs))
    1226             : //
    1227             : // The above example defines 2 accessors, one named "lhs" accessing the first
    1228             : // operand, and a one named "rhs" accessing the second operand.
    1229             : #define NAMED_OPERAND_ACCESSOR(Index, Name)                                 \
    1230             :     MDefinition* Name() const {                                             \
    1231             :         return getOperand(Index);                                           \
    1232             :     }
    1233             : #define NAMED_OPERAND_ACCESSOR_APPLY(Args)                                  \
    1234             :     NAMED_OPERAND_ACCESSOR Args
    1235             : #define NAMED_OPERANDS(...)                                                 \
    1236             :     MOZ_FOR_EACH(NAMED_OPERAND_ACCESSOR_APPLY, (), (__VA_ARGS__))
    1237             : 
    1238             : template <size_t Arity>
    1239             : class MAryInstruction : public MInstruction
    1240             : {
    1241             :     mozilla::Array<MUse, Arity> operands_;
    1242             : 
    1243             :   protected:
    1244           1 :     MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) final override {
    1245           1 :         return &operands_[index];
    1246             :     }
    1247           0 :     const MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) const final override {
    1248           1 :         return &operands_[index];
    1249             :     }
    1250             :     void initOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) {
    1251           1 :         operands_[index].init(operand, this);
    1252             :     }
    1253             : 
    1254             :   public:
    1255           1 :     MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const final override {
    1256           1 :         return operands_[index].producer();
    1257             :     }
    1258           1 :     size_t numOperands() const final override {
    1259           1 :         return Arity;
    1260             :     }
    1261             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1262             :     static const size_t staticNumOperands = Arity;
    1263             : #endif
    1264           1 :     size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const final override {
    1265             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u >= &operands_[0]);
    1266             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u <= &operands_[numOperands() - 1]);
    1267           1 :         return u - &operands_[0];
    1268             :     }
    1269           1 :     void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) final override {
    1270           1 :         operands_[index].replaceProducer(operand);
    1271           1 :     }
    1272             : 
    1273           1 :     MAryInstruction() { }
    1274             : 
    1275           1 :     explicit MAryInstruction(const MAryInstruction<Arity>& other)
    1276           1 :       : MInstruction(other)
    1277             :     {
    1278           1 :         for (int i = 0; i < (int) Arity; i++) // N.B. use |int| to avoid warnings when Arity == 0
    1279           1 :             operands_[i].init(other.operands_[i].producer(), this);
    1280           1 :     }
    1281             : };
    1282             :

    1285             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data

    1300           1 : class MBinaryInstruction : public MAryInstruction<2>
    1301             : {
    1302             :   protected:
    1303           1 :     MBinaryInstruction(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right)
    1304           1 :     {
    1305           1 :         initOperand(0, left);
    1306           1 :         initOperand(1, right);
    1307           1 :     }
    1308             : 
    1309             :   public:
    1310           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, lhs), (1, rhs))
    1311           1 :     void swapOperands() {
    1312           1 :         MDefinition* temp = getOperand(0);
    1313           1 :         replaceOperand(0, getOperand(1));
    1314           1 :         replaceOperand(1, temp);
    1315           1 :     }
    1316             : 
    1317             :   protected:
    1318           1 :     HashNumber valueHash() const
    1319             :     {
    1320           1 :         MDefinition* lhs = getOperand(0);
    1321           1 :         MDefinition* rhs = getOperand(1);
    1322             : 
    1323           1 :         return op() + lhs->id() + rhs->id();
    1324             :     }
    1325           1 :     bool binaryCongruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const
    1326             :     {
    1327           1 :         if (op() != ins->op())
    1328             :             return false;
    1329             : 
    1330           1 :         if (type() != ins->type())
    1331             :             return false;
    1332             : 
    1333           1 :         if (isEffectful() || ins->isEffectful())
    1334             :             return false;
    1335             : 
    1336           1 :         const MDefinition* left = getOperand(0);
    1337           1 :         const MDefinition* right = getOperand(1);
    1338             :         const MDefinition* tmp;
    1339             : 
    1340           1 :         if (isCommutative() && left->id() > right->id()) {
    1341           1 :             tmp = right;
    1342           1 :             right = left;
    1343           1 :             left = tmp;
    1344             :         }
    1345             : 
    1346           1 :         const MBinaryInstruction* bi = static_cast<const MBinaryInstruction*>(ins);
    1347           1 :         const MDefinition* insLeft = bi->getOperand(0);
    1348           1 :         const MDefinition* insRight = bi->getOperand(1);
    1349           1 :         if (isCommutative() && insLeft->id() > insRight->id()) {
    1350           1 :             tmp = insRight;
    1351           1 :             insRight = insLeft;
    1352           1 :             insLeft = tmp;
    1353             :         }
    1354             : 
    1355           1 :         return left == insLeft &&
    1356           1 :                right == insRight;
    1357             :     }
    1358             : 
    1359             :   public:
    1360             :     // Return if the operands to this instruction are both unsigned.
    1361             :     static bool unsignedOperands(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right);
    1362             :     bool unsignedOperands();
    1363             : 
    1364             :     // Replace any wrapping operands with the underlying int32 operands
    1365             :     // in case of unsigned operands.
    1366             :     void replaceWithUnsignedOperands();
    1367             : };

    1497             : // Truncation barrier. This is intended for protecting its input against
    1498             : // follow-up truncation optimizations.

    1537             : // A constant js::Value.
    1538           0 : class MConstant : public MNullaryInstruction
    1539             : {
    1540             :     struct Payload {
    1541             :         union {
    1542             :             bool b;
    1543             :             int32_t i32;
    1544             :             int64_t i64;
    1545             :             float f;
    1546             :             double d;
    1547             :             JSString* str;
    1548             :             JS::Symbol* sym;
    1549             :             JSObject* obj;
    1550             :             uint64_t asBits;
    1551             :         };
    1552           1 :         Payload() : asBits(0) {}
    1553             :     };
    1554             : 
    1555             :     Payload payload_;
    1556             : 
    1557             :     static_assert(sizeof(Payload) == sizeof(uint64_t),
    1558             :                   "asBits must be big enough for all payload bits");
    1559             : 
    1560             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1561             :     void assertInitializedPayload() const;
    1562             : #else
    1563             :     void assertInitializedPayload() const {}
    1564             : #endif
    1565             : 
    1566             :   protected:
    1567             :     MConstant(const Value& v, CompilerConstraintList* constraints);
    1568             :     explicit MConstant(JSObject* obj);
    1569             :     explicit MConstant(float f);
    1570             :     explicit MConstant(int64_t i);
    1571             : 
    1572             :   public:
    1573           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Constant)
    1574             :     static MConstant* New(TempAllocator& alloc, const Value& v,
    1575             :                           CompilerConstraintList* constraints = nullptr);
    1576             :     static MConstant* New(TempAllocator::Fallible alloc, const Value& v,
    1577             :                           CompilerConstraintList* constraints = nullptr);
    1578             :     static MConstant* New(TempAllocator& alloc, const Value& v, MIRType type);
    1579             :     static MConstant* NewFloat32(TempAllocator& alloc, double d);
    1580             :     static MConstant* NewInt64(TempAllocator& alloc, int64_t i);
    1581             :     static MConstant* NewConstraintlessObject(TempAllocator& alloc, JSObject* v);
    1582           0 :     static MConstant* Copy(TempAllocator& alloc, MConstant* src) {
    1583           0 :         return new(alloc) MConstant(*src);
    1584             :     }
    1585             : 
    1586             :     // Try to convert this constant to boolean, similar to js::ToBoolean.
    1587             :     // Returns false if the type is MIRType::Magic*.
    1588             :     bool MOZ_MUST_USE valueToBoolean(bool* res) const;
    1589             : 
    1590             :     // Like valueToBoolean, but returns the result directly instead of using
    1591             :     // an outparam. Should not be used if this constant might be a magic value.
    1592             :     bool valueToBooleanInfallible() const {
    1593             :         bool res;
    1594           0 :         MOZ_ALWAYS_TRUE(valueToBoolean(&res));
    1595           0 :         return res;
    1596             :     }
    1597             : 
    1598             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    1599             : 
    1600             :     HashNumber valueHash() const override;
    1601             :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override;
    1602             : 
    1603           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    1604           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    1605             :     }
    1606             : 
    1607           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool updateForReplacement(MDefinition* def) override {
    1608           1 :         MConstant* c = def->toConstant();
    1609             :         // During constant folding, we don't want to replace a float32
    1610             :         // value by a double value.
    1611           1 :         if (type() == MIRType::Float32)
    1612           1 :             return c->type() == MIRType::Float32;
    1613           1 :         if (type() == MIRType::Double)
    1614           1 :             return c->type() != MIRType::Float32;
    1615             :         return true;
    1616             :     }
    1617             : 
    1618             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    1619             :     bool needTruncation(TruncateKind kind) override;
    1620             :     void truncate() override;
    1621             : 
    1622             :     bool canProduceFloat32() const override;
    1623             : 
    1624           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MConstant)
    1625             : 
    1626             :     bool equals(const MConstant* other) const {
    1627           1 :         assertInitializedPayload();
    1628           1 :         return type() == other->type() && payload_.asBits == other->payload_.asBits;
    1629             :     }
    1630             :

    1632             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() == MIRType::Boolean);
    1633             :         return payload_.b;

    1636             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() == MIRType::Int32);

    1640             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() == MIRType::Int64);
    1641             :         return payload_.i64;

    1644           1 :         return type() == MIRType::Int32 && payload_.i32 == i;

    1653             :     }

    1655             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() == MIRType::String);

    1677             :         MOZ_ASSERT(isTypeRepresentableAsDouble());

    1683             :     }
    1684             : 
    1685             :     // Convert this constant to a js::Value. Float32 constants will be stored
    1686             :     // as DoubleValue and NaNs are canonicalized. Callers must be careful: not
    1687             :     // all constants can be represented by js::Value (wasm supports int64).
    1688             :     Value toJSValue() const;

    1692             : 
    1693             : // Floating-point value as created by wasm. Just a constant value, used to
    1694             : // effectively inhibite all the MIR optimizations. This uses the same LIR nodes
    1695             : // as a MConstant of the same type would.
    1696             : class MWasmFloatConstant : public MNullaryInstruction
    1697             : {
    1698             :     union {
    1699             :         float f32_;
    1700             :         double f64_;
    1701             :         uint64_t bits_;
    1702             :     } u;
    1703             : 
    1704             :     explicit MWasmFloatConstant(MIRType type)
    1705           1 :     {
    1706           1 :         u.bits_ = 0;
    1707           1 :         setResultType(type);
    1708             :     }
    1709             : 
    1710             :   public:
    1711           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(WasmFloatConstant)
    1712             : 
    1713           1 :     static MWasmFloatConstant* NewDouble(TempAllocator& alloc, double d) {
    1714           1 :         auto* ret = new(alloc) MWasmFloatConstant(MIRType::Double);
    1715           1 :         ret->u.f64_ = d;
    1716           1 :         return ret;
    1717             :     }
    1718             : 
    1719           0 :     static MWasmFloatConstant* NewFloat32(TempAllocator& alloc, float f) {
    1720           0 :         auto* ret = new(alloc) MWasmFloatConstant(MIRType::Float32);
    1721           0 :         ret->u.f32_ = f;
    1722           0 :         return ret;
    1723             :     }
    1724             : 
    1725             :     HashNumber valueHash() const override;
    1726             :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override;
    1727           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override { return AliasSet::None(); }
    1728             : 
    1729             :     const double& toDouble() const {
    1730             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() == MIRType::Double);
    1731             :         return u.f64_;
    1732             :     }
    1733             :     const float& toFloat32() const {
    1734             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type() == MIRType::Float32);
    1735             :         return u.f32_;
    1736             :     }

    1849             : // Converts all lanes of a given vector into the type of another vector
    1850           0 : class MSimdConvert
    1851             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    1852             :     public SimdPolicy<0>::Data
    1853             : {
    1854             :     // When either fromType or toType is an integer vector, should it be treated
    1855             :     // as signed or unsigned. Note that we don't support int-int conversions -
    1856             :     // use MSimdReinterpretCast for that.
    1857             :     SimdSign sign_;
    1858             :     wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset_;
    1859             : 
    1860           0 :     MSimdConvert(MDefinition* obj, MIRType toType, SimdSign sign,
    1861             :                  wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset)
    1862           0 :       : MUnaryInstruction(obj), sign_(sign), bytecodeOffset_(bytecodeOffset)
    1863             :     {
    1864           0 :         MIRType fromType = obj->type();
    1865             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(fromType));
    1866             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(toType));
    1867             :         // All conversions are int <-> float, so signedness is required.
    1868             :         MOZ_ASSERT(sign != SimdSign::NotApplicable);
    1869             : 
    1870           0 :         setResultType(toType);
    1871           0 :         specialization_ = fromType; // expects fromType as input
    1872             : 
    1873           0 :         setMovable();
    1874           0 :         if (IsFloatingPointSimdType(fromType) && IsIntegerSimdType(toType)) {
    1875             :             // Does the extra range check => do not remove
    1876           0 :             setGuard();
    1877             :         }
    1878           0 :     }
    1879             : 
    1880           0 :     static MSimdConvert* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* obj, MIRType toType, SimdSign sign,
    1881             :                              wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset)
    1882             :     {
    1883           0 :         return new (alloc) MSimdConvert(obj, toType, sign, bytecodeOffset);
    1884             :     }

    1886             :   public:
    1887           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdConvert)
    1888             : 
    1889             :     // Create a MSimdConvert instruction and add it to the basic block.
    1890             :     // Possibly create and add an equivalent sequence of instructions instead if
    1891             :     // the current target doesn't support the requested conversion directly.
    1892             :     // Return the inserted MInstruction that computes the converted value.

    1894             :                                       MIRType toType, SimdSign sign,
    1895             :                                       wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset = wasm::BytecodeOffset());

    1903             : 
    1904           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    1905           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    1906             :     }
    1907           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    1908           0 :         if (!congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins))
    1909             :             return false;
    1910           0 :         const MSimdConvert* other = ins->toSimdConvert();
    1911           0 :         return sign_ == other->sign_;
    1912             :     }
    1913           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdConvert)

    1944             : 
    1945             : // Extracts a lane element from a given vector type, given by its lane symbol.
    1946             : //
    1947             : // For integer SIMD types, a SimdSign must be provided so the lane value can be
    1948             : // converted to a scalar correctly.
    1949           0 : class MSimdExtractElement
    1950             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    1951             :     public SimdPolicy<0>::Data
    1952             : {
    1953             :   protected:
    1954             :     unsigned lane_;
    1955             :     SimdSign sign_;
    1956             : 
    1957           0 :     MSimdExtractElement(MDefinition* obj, MIRType laneType, unsigned lane, SimdSign sign)
    1958           0 :       : MUnaryInstruction(obj), lane_(lane), sign_(sign)
    1959             :     {
    1960           0 :         MIRType vecType = obj->type();
    1961             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(vecType));
    1962             :         MOZ_ASSERT(lane < SimdTypeToLength(vecType));
    1963             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!IsSimdType(laneType));
    1964             :         MOZ_ASSERT((sign != SimdSign::NotApplicable) == IsIntegerSimdType(vecType),
    1965             :                    "Signedness must be specified for integer SIMD extractLanes");
    1966             :         // The resulting type should match the lane type.
    1967             :         // Allow extracting boolean lanes directly into an Int32 (for wasm).
    1968             :         // Allow extracting Uint32 lanes into a double.
    1969             :         //
    1970             :         // We also allow extracting Uint32 lanes into a MIRType::Int32. This is
    1971             :         // equivalent to extracting the Uint32 lane to a double and then
    1972             :         // applying MTruncateToInt32, but it bypasses the conversion to/from
    1973             :         // double.
    1974             :         MOZ_ASSERT(SimdTypeToLaneType(vecType) == laneType ||
    1975             :                    (IsBooleanSimdType(vecType) && laneType == MIRType::Int32) ||
    1976             :                    (vecType == MIRType::Int32x4 && laneType == MIRType::Double &&
    1977             :                     sign == SimdSign::Unsigned));
    1978             : 
    1979           0 :         setMovable();
    1980           0 :         specialization_ = vecType;
    1981           0 :         setResultType(laneType);
    1982           0 :     }
    1983             : 
    1984             :   public:
    1985           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdExtractElement)
    1986           0 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    1987             : 
    1988             :     unsigned lane() const {
    1989             :         return lane_;
    1990             :     }
    1991             : 
    1992             :     SimdSign signedness() const {
    1993             :         return sign_;
    1994             :     }
    1995             : 
    1996           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    1997           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    1998             :     }
    1999           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2000           0 :         if (!ins->isSimdExtractElement())
    2001             :             return false;
    2002           0 :         const MSimdExtractElement* other = ins->toSimdExtractElement();
    2003           0 :         if (other->lane_ != lane_ || other->sign_ != sign_)
    2004             :             return false;
    2005           0 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
    2006             :     }
    2007           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdExtractElement)
    2008             : };
    2009             : 
    2010             : // Replaces the datum in the given lane by a scalar value of the same type.

    2034             :         return lane_;
    2035             :     }
    2036             : 
    2037           0 :     bool canConsumeFloat32(MUse* use) const override {
    2038           0 :         return use == getUseFor(1) && SimdTypeToLaneType(type()) == MIRType::Float32;
    2039             :     }
    2040             : 
    2041           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    2042           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2043             :     }

    2045           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2046           0 :         return binaryCongruentTo(ins) && lane_ == ins->toSimdInsertElement()->lane();
    2047             :     }
