    2114             : 
    2115             : // Base for the MSimdSwizzle and MSimdShuffle classes.
    2116             : class MSimdShuffleBase
    2117             : {
    2118             :   protected:
    2119             :     // As of now, there are at most 16 lanes. For each lane, we need to know
    2120             :     // which input we choose and which of the lanes we choose.
    2121             :     mozilla::Array<uint8_t, 16> lane_;
    2122             :     uint32_t arity_;
    2123             : 
    2124             :     MSimdShuffleBase(const uint8_t lanes[], MIRType type)
    2125           0 :     {
    2126           0 :         arity_ = SimdTypeToLength(type);
    2127           0 :         for (unsigned i = 0; i < arity_; i++)
    2128           0 :             lane_[i] = lanes[i];
    2129             :     }
    2130             : 
    2131           0 :     bool sameLanes(const MSimdShuffleBase* other) const {
    2132           0 :         return arity_ == other->arity_ &&
    2133           0 :                memcmp(&lane_[0], &other->lane_[0], arity_) == 0;
    2134             :     }
    2135             : 
    2136             :   public:
    2137             :     unsigned numLanes() const {
    2138             :         return arity_;
    2139             :     }
    2140             : 
    2141             :     unsigned lane(unsigned i) const {
    2142             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < arity_);
    2143           0 :         return lane_[i];
    2144             :     }
    2145             : 
    2146             :     bool lanesMatch(uint32_t x, uint32_t y, uint32_t z, uint32_t w) const {
    2147           0 :         return arity_ == 4 && lane(0) == x && lane(1) == y && lane(2) == z &&
    2148             :                lane(3) == w;
    2149             :     }
    2150             : };
    2151             : 
    2152             : // Applies a swizzle operation to the input, putting the input lanes as
    2153             : // indicated in the output register's lanes. This implements the SIMD.js
    2154             : // "swizzle" function, that takes one vector and an array of lane indexes.
    2155           0 : class MSimdSwizzle
    2156             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    2157             :     public MSimdShuffleBase,
    2158             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    2159             : {
    2160             :   protected:
    2161           0 :     MSimdSwizzle(MDefinition* obj, const uint8_t lanes[])
    2162           0 :       : MUnaryInstruction(obj), MSimdShuffleBase(lanes, obj->type())
    2163             :     {
    2164           0 :         for (unsigned i = 0; i < arity_; i++)
    2165             :             MOZ_ASSERT(lane(i) < arity_);
    2166           0 :         setResultType(obj->type());
    2167           0 :         setMovable();
    2168           0 :     }
    2169             : 
    2170             :   public:
    2171           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdSwizzle)
    2172           0 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    2173             : 
    2174           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2175           0 :         if (!ins->isSimdSwizzle())
    2176             :             return false;
    2177           0 :         const MSimdSwizzle* other = ins->toSimdSwizzle();
    2178           0 :         return sameLanes(other) && congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
    2179             :     }
    2180             : 
    2181           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    2182           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2183             :     }
    2184             : 
    2185             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    2186             : 
    2187           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdSwizzle)
    2188             : };
    2189             : 
    2190             : // A "general shuffle" is a swizzle or a shuffle with non-constant lane
    2191             : // indices.  This is the one that Ion inlines and it can be folded into a
    2192             : // MSimdSwizzle/MSimdShuffle if lane indices are constant.  Performance of
    2193             : // general swizzle/shuffle does not really matter, as we expect to get
    2194             : // constant indices most of the time.
    2195             : class MSimdGeneralShuffle :
    2196             :     public MVariadicInstruction,
    2197             :     public SimdShufflePolicy::Data
    2198             : {
    2199             :     unsigned numVectors_;
    2200             :     unsigned numLanes_;
    2201             : 
    2202             :   protected:
    2203             :     MSimdGeneralShuffle(unsigned numVectors, unsigned numLanes, MIRType type)
    2204           0 :       : numVectors_(numVectors), numLanes_(numLanes)
    2205             :     {
    2206             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(type));
    2207             :         MOZ_ASSERT(SimdTypeToLength(type) == numLanes_);
    2208             : 
    2209           0 :         setResultType(type);
    2210           0 :         specialization_ = type;
    2211           0 :         setGuard(); // throws if lane index is out of bounds
    2212           0 :         setMovable();
    2213             :     }
    2214             : 
    2215             :   public:
    2216           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdGeneralShuffle);
    2217           0 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    2218             : 
    2219             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool init(TempAllocator& alloc) {
    2220           0 :         return MVariadicInstruction::init(alloc, numVectors_ + numLanes_);
    2221             :     }
    2222             :     void setVector(unsigned i, MDefinition* vec) {
    2223             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numVectors_);
    2224           0 :         initOperand(i, vec);
    2225             :     }
    2226             :     void setLane(unsigned i, MDefinition* laneIndex) {
    2227             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numLanes_);
    2228           0 :         initOperand(numVectors_ + i, laneIndex);
    2229             :     }
    2230             : 
    2231             :     unsigned numVectors() const {
    2232             :         return numVectors_;
    2233             :     }
    2234             :     unsigned numLanes() const {
    2235             :         return numLanes_;
    2236             :     }
    2237             :     MDefinition* vector(unsigned i) const {
    2238             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numVectors_);
    2239           0 :         return getOperand(i);
    2240             :     }
    2241             :     MDefinition* lane(unsigned i) const {
    2242             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numLanes_);
    2243           0 :         return getOperand(numVectors_ + i);
    2244             :     }
    2245             : 
    2246           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2247           0 :         if (!ins->isSimdGeneralShuffle())
    2248             :             return false;
    2249           0 :         const MSimdGeneralShuffle* other = ins->toSimdGeneralShuffle();
    2250           0 :         return numVectors_ == other->numVectors() &&
    2251           0 :                numLanes_ == other->numLanes() &&
    2252           0 :                congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
    2253             :     }
    2254             : 
    2255             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    2256             : 
    2257           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    2258           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2259             :     }
    2260             : };
    2261             : 
    2262             : // Applies a shuffle operation to the inputs. The lane indexes select a source
    2263             : // lane from the concatenation of the two input vectors.
    2264           0 : class MSimdShuffle
    2265             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    2266             :     public MSimdShuffleBase,
    2267             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    2268             : {
    2269           0 :     MSimdShuffle(MDefinition* lhs, MDefinition* rhs, const uint8_t lanes[])
    2270           0 :       : MBinaryInstruction(lhs, rhs), MSimdShuffleBase(lanes, lhs->type())
    2271             :     {
    2272             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(lhs->type()));
    2273             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(rhs->type()));
    2274             :         MOZ_ASSERT(lhs->type() == rhs->type());
    2275           0 :         for (unsigned i = 0; i < arity_; i++)
    2276             :             MOZ_ASSERT(lane(i) < 2 * arity_);
    2277           0 :         setResultType(lhs->type());
    2278           0 :         setMovable();
    2279           0 :     }
    2280             : 
    2281             :   public:
    2282           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdShuffle)
    2283             : 
    2284           0 :     static MInstruction* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* lhs, MDefinition* rhs,
    2285             :                              const uint8_t lanes[])
    2286             :     {
    2287           0 :         unsigned arity = SimdTypeToLength(lhs->type());
    2288             : 
    2289             :         // Swap operands so that new lanes come from LHS in majority.
    2290             :         // In the balanced case, swap operands if needs be, in order to be able
    2291             :         // to do only one vshufps on x86.
    2292           0 :         unsigned lanesFromLHS = 0;
    2293           0 :         for (unsigned i = 0; i < arity; i++) {
    2294           0 :             if (lanes[i] < arity)
    2295           0 :                 lanesFromLHS++;
    2296             :         }
    2297             : 
    2298           0 :         if (lanesFromLHS < arity / 2 ||
    2299           0 :             (arity == 4 && lanesFromLHS == 2 && lanes[0] >= 4 && lanes[1] >= 4)) {
    2300             :             mozilla::Array<uint8_t, 16> newLanes;
    2301           0 :             for (unsigned i = 0; i < arity; i++)
    2302           0 :                 newLanes[i] = (lanes[i] + arity) % (2 * arity);
    2303           0 :             return New(alloc, rhs, lhs, &newLanes[0]);
    2304             :         }
    2305             : 
    2306             :         // If all lanes come from the same vector, just use swizzle instead.
    2307           0 :         if (lanesFromLHS == arity)
    2308           0 :             return MSimdSwizzle::New(alloc, lhs, lanes);
    2309             : 
    2310           0 :         return new(alloc) MSimdShuffle(lhs, rhs, lanes);
    2311             :     }
    2312             : 
    2313           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2314           0 :         if (!ins->isSimdShuffle())
    2315             :             return false;
    2316           0 :         const MSimdShuffle* other = ins->toSimdShuffle();
    2317           0 :         return sameLanes(other) && binaryCongruentTo(other);
    2318             :     }
    2319             : 
    2320           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    2321           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2322             :     }
    2323             : 
    2324           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdShuffle)
    2325             : };
    2326             : 
    2327           0 : class MSimdUnaryArith
    2328             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    2329             :     public SimdSameAsReturnedTypePolicy<0>::Data
    2330             : {
    2331             :   public:
    2332             :     enum Operation {
    2333             : #define OP_LIST_(OP) OP,
    2334             :         FOREACH_FLOAT_SIMD_UNOP(OP_LIST_)
    2335             :         neg,
    2336             :         not_
    2337             : #undef OP_LIST_
    2338             :     };

    2340           0 :     static const char* OperationName(Operation op) {
    2341           0 :         switch (op) {
    2342             :           case abs:                         return "abs";
    2343           0 :           case neg:                         return "neg";
    2344           0 :           case not_:                        return "not";
    2345           0 :           case reciprocalApproximation:     return "reciprocalApproximation";
    2346           0 :           case reciprocalSqrtApproximation: return "reciprocalSqrtApproximation";
    2347           0 :           case sqrt:                        return "sqrt";
    2348             :         }
    2349           0 :         MOZ_CRASH("unexpected operation");
    2350             :     }
    2351             : 
    2352             :   private:
    2353             :     Operation operation_;

    2357             :     {
    2358           0 :         MIRType type = def->type();
    2359             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(type));
    2360             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(IsIntegerSimdType(type), op == neg || op == not_);
    2361           0 :         setResultType(type);
    2362           0 :         setMovable();
    2363           0 :     }
    2364             :

    2369             :     Operation operation() const { return operation_; }
    2370             : 
    2371           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    2372           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2373             :     }
    2374             : 
    2375           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2376           0 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins) && ins->toSimdUnaryArith()->operation() == operation();
    2377             :     }
    2378             : 
    2379             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    2380             : 
    2381           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdUnaryArith);
    2382             : };
    2383             : 
    2384             : // Compares each value of a SIMD vector to each corresponding lane's value of
    2385             : // another SIMD vector, and returns a boolean vector containing the results of
    2386             : // the comparison: all bits are set to 1 if the comparison is true, 0 otherwise.
    2387             : // When comparing integer vectors, a SimdSign must be provided to request signed
    2388             : // or unsigned comparison.
    2389           0 : class MSimdBinaryComp
    2390             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    2391             :     public SimdAllPolicy::Data
    2392             : {
    2393             :   public:
    2394             :     enum Operation {
    2395             : #define NAME_(x) x,
    2396             :         FOREACH_COMP_SIMD_OP(NAME_)
    2397             : #undef NAME_
    2398             :     };
    2399             : 
    2400           0 :     static const char* OperationName(Operation op) {
    2401           0 :         switch (op) {
    2402             : #define NAME_(x) case x: return #x;
    2403           0 :         FOREACH_COMP_SIMD_OP(NAME_)
    2404             : #undef NAME_
    2405             :         }
    2406           0 :         MOZ_CRASH("unexpected operation");
    2407             :     }
    2408             : 
    2409             :   private:
    2410             :     Operation operation_;
    2411             :     SimdSign sign_;
    2412             : 
    2413           0 :     MSimdBinaryComp(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right, Operation op, SimdSign sign)
    2414           0 :       : MBinaryInstruction(left, right), operation_(op), sign_(sign)
    2415             :     {
    2416             :         MOZ_ASSERT(left->type() == right->type());
    2417           0 :         MIRType opType = left->type();
    2418             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(opType));
    2419             :         MOZ_ASSERT((sign != SimdSign::NotApplicable) == IsIntegerSimdType(opType),
    2420             :                    "Signedness must be specified for integer SIMD compares");
    2421           0 :         setResultType(MIRTypeToBooleanSimdType(opType));
    2422           0 :         specialization_ = opType;
    2423           0 :         setMovable();
    2424           0 :         if (op == equal || op == notEqual)
    2425           0 :             setCommutative();
    2426           0 :     }
    2427             : 
    2428             :     static MSimdBinaryComp* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right,
    2429             :                                 Operation op, SimdSign sign)
    2430             :     {
    2431           0 :         return new (alloc) MSimdBinaryComp(left, right, op, sign);
    2432             :     }
    2433             : 
    2434             :   public:
    2435           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdBinaryComp)
    2436             : 
    2437             :     // Create a MSimdBinaryComp or an equivalent sequence of instructions
    2438             :     // supported by the current target.
    2439             :     // Add all instructions to the basic block |addTo|.
    2440             :     static MInstruction* AddLegalized(TempAllocator& alloc, MBasicBlock* addTo, MDefinition* left,
    2441             :                                       MDefinition* right, Operation op, SimdSign sign);
    2442             : 
    2443           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override
    2444             :     {
    2445           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2446             :     }
    2447             : 
    2448             :     Operation operation() const { return operation_; }
    2449             :     SimdSign signedness() const { return sign_; }
    2450             :     MIRType specialization() const { return specialization_; }
    2451             : 
    2452             :     // Swap the operands and reverse the comparison predicate.
    2453           0 :     void reverse() {
    2454           0 :         switch (operation()) {
    2455           0 :           case greaterThan:        operation_ = lessThan; break;
    2456           0 :           case greaterThanOrEqual: operation_ = lessThanOrEqual; break;
    2457           0 :           case lessThan:           operation_ = greaterThan; break;
    2458           0 :           case lessThanOrEqual:    operation_ = greaterThanOrEqual; break;
    2459             :           case equal:
    2460             :           case notEqual:
    2461             :             break;
    2462           0 :           default: MOZ_CRASH("Unexpected compare operation");
    2463             :         }
    2464           0 :         swapOperands();
    2465           0 :     }
    2466             : 
    2467           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2468           0 :         if (!binaryCongruentTo(ins))
    2469             :             return false;
    2470           0 :         const MSimdBinaryComp* other = ins->toSimdBinaryComp();
    2471           0 :         return specialization_ == other->specialization() &&
    2472           0 :                operation_ == other->operation() &&
    2473           0 :                sign_ == other->signedness();
    2474             :     }
    2475             : 
    2476             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    2477             : 
    2478           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdBinaryComp)
    2479             : };

    2668           0 : class MSimdShift
    2669             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    2670             :     public MixPolicy<SimdSameAsReturnedTypePolicy<0>, SimdScalarPolicy<1> >::Data
    2671             : {
    2672             :   public:
    2673             :     enum Operation {
    2674             :         lsh,
    2675             :         rsh,
    2676             :         ursh
    2677             :     };
    2678             : 
    2679             :   private:
    2680             :     Operation operation_;
    2681             : 
    2682             :     MSimdShift(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right, Operation op)
    2683           0 :       : MBinaryInstruction(left, right), operation_(op)
    2684             :     {
    2685           0 :         MIRType type = left->type();

    2687           0 :         setResultType(type);
    2688           0 :         setMovable();
    2689             :     }

    2692             :                            Operation op)

    2694           0 :         return new (alloc) MSimdShift(left, right, op);
    2695             :     }

    2697             :   public:
    2698           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(SimdShift)
    2699             : 
    2700             :     // Create an MSimdShift instruction and add it to the basic block. Possibly
    2701             :     // create and add an equivalent sequence of instructions instead if the
    2702             :     // current target doesn't support the requested shift operation directly.
    2703             :     // Return the inserted MInstruction that computes the shifted value.
    2704             :     static MInstruction* AddLegalized(TempAllocator& alloc, MBasicBlock* addTo, MDefinition* left,
    2705             :                                       MDefinition* right, Operation op);
    2706             : 
    2707             :     // Get the relevant right shift operation given the signedness of a type.
    2708             :     static Operation rshForSign(SimdSign sign) {
    2709           0 :         return sign == SimdSign::Unsigned ? ursh : rsh;
    2710             :     }
    2711             : 
    2712           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    2713           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    2714             :     }
    2715             : 
    2716             :     Operation operation() const { return operation_; }
    2717             : 
    2718           0 :     static const char* OperationName(Operation op) {
    2719           0 :         switch (op) {
    2720             :           case lsh:  return "lsh";
    2721           0 :           case rsh:  return "rsh-arithmetic";
    2722           0 :           case ursh: return "rsh-logical";
    2723             :         }
    2724           0 :         MOZ_CRASH("unexpected operation");
    2725             :     }
    2726             : 
    2727             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    2728             : 
    2729           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    2730           0 :         if (!binaryCongruentTo(ins))
    2731             :             return false;
    2732           0 :         return operation_ == ins->toSimdShift()->operation();
    2733             :     }
    2734             : 
    2735           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdShift)
    2736             : };

    2871             : class MTableSwitch final
    2872             :   : public MControlInstruction,
    2873             :     public NoFloatPolicy<0>::Data
    2874             : {
    2875             :     // The successors of the tableswitch
    2876             :     // - First successor = the default case
    2877             :     // - Successors 2 and higher = the cases
    2878             :     Vector<MBasicBlock*, 0, JitAllocPolicy> successors_;
    2879             :     // Index into successors_ sorted on case index
    2880             :     Vector<size_t, 0, JitAllocPolicy> cases_;
    2881             : 
    2882             :     MUse operand_;
    2883             :     int32_t low_;
    2884             :     int32_t high_;
    2885             : 
    2886             :     void initOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) {
    2887             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
    2888           1 :         operand_.init(operand, this);
    2889             :     }
    2890             : 
    2891           1 :     MTableSwitch(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* ins,
    2892             :                  int32_t low, int32_t high)
    2893             :       : successors_(alloc),
    2894             :         cases_(alloc),
    2895             :         low_(low),
    2896           1 :         high_(high)
    2897             :     {
    2898           1 :         initOperand(0, ins);
    2899           1 :     }
    2900             : 
    2901             :   protected:
    2902           1 :     MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) override {
    2903             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
    2904           1 :         return &operand_;
    2905             :     }
    2906             : 
    2907           0 :     const MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) const override {
    2908             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
    2909           0 :         return &operand_;
    2910             :     }
    2911             : 
    2912             :   public:

    2914             :     static MTableSwitch* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* ins, int32_t low, int32_t high);
    2915             : 
    2916           1 :     size_t numSuccessors() const override {
    2917           1 :         return successors_.length();
    2918             :     }
    2919             : 
    2920           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addSuccessor(MBasicBlock* successor, size_t* index) {
    2921             :         MOZ_ASSERT(successors_.length() < (size_t)(high_ - low_ + 2));
    2922             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!successors_.empty());
    2923           1 :         *index = successors_.length();
    2924           1 :         return successors_.append(successor);
    2925             :     }
    2926             : 
    2927           1 :     MBasicBlock* getSuccessor(size_t i) const override {
    2928             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numSuccessors());
    2929           1 :         return successors_[i];
    2930             :     }
    2931             : 
    2932           1 :     void replaceSuccessor(size_t i, MBasicBlock* successor) override {
    2933             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numSuccessors());
    2934           1 :         successors_[i] = successor;
    2935           1 :     }
    2936             : 
    2937             :     int32_t low() const {
    2938             :         return low_;
    2939             :     }
    2940             : 
    2941             :     int32_t high() const {
    2942             :         return high_;
    2943             :     }
    2944             : 
    2945             :     MBasicBlock* getDefault() const {
    2946             :         return getSuccessor(0);
    2947             :     }
    2948             : 
    2949             :     MBasicBlock* getCase(size_t i) const {
    2950           1 :         return getSuccessor(cases_[i]);
    2951             :     }
    2952             : 
    2953           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addDefault(MBasicBlock* block, size_t* index = nullptr) {
    2954             :         MOZ_ASSERT(successors_.empty());
    2955           1 :         if (index)
    2956           1 :             *index = 0;
    2957           1 :         return successors_.append(block);
    2958             :     }
    2959             : 
    2960           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addCase(size_t successorIndex) {
    2961           1 :         return cases_.append(successorIndex);
    2962             :     }
    2963             : 
    2964             :     size_t numCases() const {
    2965           1 :         return high() - low() + 1;
    2966             :     }
    2967             : 
    2968           1 :     MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const override {
    2969             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
    2970           1 :         return operand_.producer();
    2971             :     }
    2972             : 
    2973           1 :     size_t numOperands() const override {
    2974           1 :         return 1;
    2975             :     }
    2976             : 
    2977           1 :     size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const final override {
    2978             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u == getUseFor(0));
    2979           1 :         return 0;
    2980             :     }
    2981             : 
    2982           0 :     void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) final override {
    2983             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
    2984           0 :         operand_.replaceProducer(operand);
    2985           0 :     }

    3002           1 :         return &operands_[index];

    3005           0 :         return &operands_[index];
    3006             :     }

    3008           1 :         operands_[index].init(operand, this);
    3009             :     }

    3012           1 :     MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const final override {
    3013           1 :         return operands_[index].producer();
    3014             :     }
    3015           1 :     size_t numOperands() const final override {
    3016           1 :         return Arity;
    3017             :     }
    3018           1 :     size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const final override {
    3019             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u >= &operands_[0]);

    3021           1 :         return u - &operands_[0];
    3022             :     }
    3023           1 :     void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) final override {
    3024           1 :         operands_[index].replaceProducer(operand);
    3025           1 :     }
    3026           1 :     size_t numSuccessors() const final override {
    3027           1 :         return Successors;
    3028             :     }

    3030           1 :         return successors_[i];
    3031             :     }

    3064             : enum BranchDirection {
    3065             :     FALSE_BRANCH,
    3066             :     TRUE_BRANCH
    3067             : };
    3068             : 
    3069             : static inline BranchDirection
    3070             : NegateBranchDirection(BranchDirection dir)
    3071             : {
    3072           1 :     return (dir == FALSE_BRANCH) ? TRUE_BRANCH : FALSE_BRANCH;
    3073             : }

    3075             : // Tests if the input instruction evaluates to true or false, and jumps to the
    3076             : // start of a corresponding basic block.
    3077             : class MTest
    3078             :   : public MAryControlInstruction<1, 2>,
    3079             :     public TestPolicy::Data
    3080             : {
    3081             :     bool operandMightEmulateUndefined_;
    3082             : 
    3083             :     MTest(MDefinition* ins, MBasicBlock* trueBranch, MBasicBlock* falseBranch)
    3084           1 :       : operandMightEmulateUndefined_(true)
    3085             :     {
    3086           1 :         initOperand(0, ins);
    3087           1 :         setSuccessor(0, trueBranch);
    3088           1 :         setSuccessor(1, falseBranch);
    3089             :     }
    3090             : 
    3091             :     // Variant which may patch the ifTrue branch later.
    3092             :     MTest(MDefinition* ins, MBasicBlock* falseBranch)
    3093             :       : MTest(ins, nullptr, falseBranch)
    3094             :     {}
    3095             : 
    3096             :   public:
    3097           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Test)
    3098           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    3099           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, input))
    3100             : 
    3101             :     static const size_t TrueBranchIndex = 0;
    3102             : 
    3103             :     MBasicBlock* ifTrue() const {
    3104           1 :         return getSuccessor(0);
    3105             :     }
    3106             :     MBasicBlock* ifFalse() const {
    3107           1 :         return getSuccessor(1);
    3108             :     }
    3109             :     MBasicBlock* branchSuccessor(BranchDirection dir) const {
    3110           1 :         return (dir == TRUE_BRANCH) ? ifTrue() : ifFalse();
    3111             :     }
    3112             : 
    3113           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    3114           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    3115             :     }
    3116             : 
    3117             :     // We cache whether our operand might emulate undefined, but we don't want
    3118             :     // to do that from New() or the constructor, since those can be called on
    3119             :     // background threads.  So make callers explicitly call it if they want us
    3120             :     // to check whether the operand might do this.  If this method is never
    3121             :     // called, we'll assume our operand can emulate undefined.
    3122             :     void cacheOperandMightEmulateUndefined(CompilerConstraintList* constraints);
    3123             :     MDefinition* foldsDoubleNegation(TempAllocator& alloc);
    3124             :     MDefinition* foldsConstant(TempAllocator& alloc);

    3129             :                                 bool* filtersNull);

    3131             :     void markNoOperandEmulatesUndefined() {
    3132           1 :         operandMightEmulateUndefined_ = false;
    3133             :     }
    3134             :     bool operandMightEmulateUndefined() const {
    3135             :         return operandMightEmulateUndefined_;
    3136             :     }
    3137             : #ifdef DEBUG
    3138             :     bool isConsistentFloat32Use(MUse* use) const override {
    3139             :         return true;
    3140             :     }
    3141             : #endif
    3142             : };

    3229             :                     JSValueType unboxedType, MIRType input, TypeSet* inputTypes);

    3257             :                             uint32_t length, MConstant* templateConst,

    3284             :         return convertDoubleElements_;
    3285             :     }
    3286             : 
    3287             :     // NewArray is marked as non-effectful because all our allocations are
    3288             :     // either lazy when we are using "new Array(length)" or bounded by the
    3289             :     // script or the stack size when we are using "new Array(...)" or "[...]"
    3290             :     // notations.  So we might have to allocate the array twice if we bail
    3291             :     // during the computation of the first element of the square braket
    3292             :     // notation.
    3293           1 :     virtual AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    3294           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    3295             :     }
    3296             : 
    3297             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const override;
    3298           1 :     bool canRecoverOnBailout() const override {
    3299             :         // The template object can safely be used in the recover instruction
    3300             :         // because it can never be mutated by any other function execution.
    3301           1 :         return templateObject() != nullptr;
    3302             :     }
    3303             : };

    3467             : class MNewObject
    3468             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    3469             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    3470             : {
    3471             :   public:
    3472             :     enum Mode { ObjectLiteral, ObjectCreate };
    3473             : 
    3474             :   private:
    3475             :     gc::InitialHeap initialHeap_;
    3476             :     Mode mode_;
    3477             :     bool vmCall_;
    3478             : 
    3479           1 :     MNewObject(CompilerConstraintList* constraints, MConstant* templateConst,
    3480             :                gc::InitialHeap initialHeap, Mode mode, bool vmCall = false)
    3481             :       : MUnaryInstruction(templateConst),
    3482             :         initialHeap_(initialHeap),
    3483             :         mode_(mode),
    3484           1 :         vmCall_(vmCall)
    3485             :     {
    3486             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(mode != ObjectLiteral, templateObject());
    3487           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Object);
    3488             : 
    3489           1 :         if (JSObject* obj = templateObject())
    3490           1 :             setResultTypeSet(MakeSingletonTypeSet(constraints, obj));
    3491             : 
    3492             :         // The constant is kept separated in a MConstant, this way we can safely
    3493             :         // mark it during GC if we recover the object allocation.  Otherwise, by
    3494             :         // making it emittedAtUses, we do not produce register allocations for
    3495             :         // it and inline its content inside the code produced by the
    3496             :         // CodeGenerator.
    3497           1 :         if (templateConst->toConstant()->type() == MIRType::Object)
    3498           1 :             templateConst->setEmittedAtUses();
    3499           1 :     }

    3628             : 
    3629             : // Generic way for constructing a SIMD object in IonMonkey, this instruction
    3630             : // takes as argument a SIMD instruction and returns a new SIMD object which
    3631             : // corresponds to the MIRType of its operand.
    3632             : class MSimdBox
    3633             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    3634             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    3635             : {
    3636             :   protected:
    3637             :     CompilerGCPointer<InlineTypedObject*> templateObject_;
    3638             :     SimdType simdType_;
    3639             :     gc::InitialHeap initialHeap_;
    3640             : 
    3641           0 :     MSimdBox(CompilerConstraintList* constraints,
    3642             :              MDefinition* op,
    3643             :              InlineTypedObject* templateObject,
    3644             :              SimdType simdType,
    3645             :              gc::InitialHeap initialHeap)
    3646             :       : MUnaryInstruction(op),
    3647             :         templateObject_(templateObject),
    3648             :         simdType_(simdType),
    3649           0 :         initialHeap_(initialHeap)
    3650             :     {
    3651             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(op->type()));
    3652           0 :         setMovable();
    3653           0 :         setResultType(MIRType::Object);
    3654           0 :         if (constraints)
    3655           0 :             setResultTypeSet(MakeSingletonTypeSet(constraints, templateObject));
    3656           0 :     }
    3657             : 
    3658             :   public:

    3660           0 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS

    3663           0 :         return templateObject_;
    3664             :     }

    3666             :     SimdType simdType() const {
    3667             :         return simdType_;
    3668             :     }
    3669             : 
    3670             :     gc::InitialHeap initialHeap() const {
    3671             :         return initialHeap_;
    3672             :     }
    3673             : 
    3674           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    3675           0 :         if (!congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins))
    3676             :             return false;
    3677           0 :         const MSimdBox* box = ins->toSimdBox();
    3678           0 :         if (box->simdType() != simdType())
    3679             :             return false;
    3680             :         MOZ_ASSERT(box->templateObject() == templateObject());
    3681           0 :         if (box->initialHeap() != initialHeap())
    3682             :             return false;
    3683           0 :         return true;
    3684             :     }
    3685             : 
    3686           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    3687           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    3688             :     }

    3701           0 : class MSimdUnbox
    3702             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,

    3713             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsSimdType(type));
    3714           0 :         setGuard();
    3715           0 :         setMovable();

    3717           0 :     }

    3721           0 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    3722           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MSimdUnbox)
    3723             : 
    3724             :     SimdType simdType() const { return simdType_; }
    3725             : 
    3726             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    3727           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    3728           0 :         if (!congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins))
    3729             :             return false;
    3730           0 :         return ins->toSimdUnbox()->simdType() == simdType();
    3731             :     }
    3732             : 
    3733           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    3734           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    3735             :     }
    3736             : 
    3737             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    3738             : };
    3739             : 
    3740             : // Creates a new derived type object. At runtime, this is just a call
    3741             : // to `BinaryBlock::createDerived()`. That is, the MIR itself does not
    3742             : // compile to particularly optimized code. However, using a distinct
    3743             : // MIR for creating derived type objects allows the compiler to
    3744             : // optimize ephemeral typed objects as would be created for a
    3745             : // reference like `a.b.c` -- here, the `a.b` will create an ephemeral
    3746             : // derived type object that aliases the memory of `a` itself. The
    3747             : // specific nature of `a.b` is revealed by using
    3748             : // `MNewDerivedTypedObject` rather than `MGetProperty` or what have
    3749             : // you. Moreover, the compiler knows that there are no side-effects,
    3750             : // so `MNewDerivedTypedObject` instructions can be reordered or pruned
    3751             : // as dead code.
    3752             : class MNewDerivedTypedObject
    3753             :   : public MTernaryInstruction,
    3754             :     public Mix3Policy<ObjectPolicy<0>,
    3755             :                       ObjectPolicy<1>,
    3756             :                       IntPolicy<2> >::Data
    3757             : {
    3758             :   private:
    3759             :     TypedObjectPrediction prediction_;
    3760             : 
    3761             :     MNewDerivedTypedObject(TypedObjectPrediction prediction,
    3762             :                            MDefinition* type,
    3763             :                            MDefinition* owner,
    3764             :                            MDefinition* offset)
    3765             :       : MTernaryInstruction(type, owner, offset),
    3766           0 :         prediction_(prediction)
    3767             :     {
    3768           0 :         setMovable();
    3769           0 :         setResultType(MIRType::Object);
    3770             :     }
    3771             : 
    3772             :   public:
    3773           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(NewDerivedTypedObject)
    3774           0 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    3775           0 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, type), (1, owner), (2, offset))
    3776             : 
    3777             :     TypedObjectPrediction prediction() const {
    3778           0 :         return prediction_;
    3779             :     }
    3780             : 
    3781           0 :     virtual AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    3782           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    3783             :     }
    3784             : 
    3785             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const override;
    3786           0 :     bool canRecoverOnBailout() const override {
    3787           0 :         return true;
    3788             :     }
    3789             : };
    3790             : 
    3791             : // This vector is used when the recovered object is kept unboxed. We map the
    3792             : // offset of each property to the index of the corresponding operands in the
    3793             : // object state.
    3794           1 : struct OperandIndexMap : public TempObject
    3795             : {
    3796             :     // The number of properties is limited by scalar replacement. Thus we cannot
    3797             :     // have any large number of properties.
    3798             :     FixedList<uint8_t> map;
    3799             : 
    3800             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool init(TempAllocator& alloc, JSObject* templateObject);
    3801             : };
    3802             : 
    3803             : // Represent the content of all slots of an object.  This instruction is not
    3804             : // lowered and is not used to generate code.
    3805             : class MObjectState
    3806             :   : public MVariadicInstruction,
    3807             :     public NoFloatPolicyAfter<1>::Data
    3808             : {
    3809             :   private:
    3810             :     uint32_t numSlots_;
    3811             :     uint32_t numFixedSlots_;        // valid if isUnboxed() == false.
    3812             :     OperandIndexMap* operandIndex_; // valid if isUnboxed() == true.
    3813             : 
    3814             :     bool isUnboxed() const {
    3815             :         return operandIndex_ != nullptr;
    3816             :     }
    3817             : 
    3818             :     MObjectState(JSObject *templateObject, OperandIndexMap* operandIndex);

    3824           1 :         initOperand(slot + 1, def);
    3825             :     }

    3847           1 :         return numSlots_;

    3851           1 :         return getOperand(slot + 1);

    3854           1 :         replaceOperand(slot + 1, def);

    3858           1 :         return slot < numSlots() && slot < numFixedSlots();

    3861             :         MOZ_ASSERT(slot < numFixedSlots());
    3862             :         return getSlot(slot);
    3863             :     }
    3864             :     void setFixedSlot(uint32_t slot, MDefinition* def) {
    3865             :         MOZ_ASSERT(slot < numFixedSlots());
    3866             :         setSlot(slot, def);
    3867             :     }
    3868             : 
    3869             :     bool hasDynamicSlot(uint32_t slot) const {
    3870           0 :         return numFixedSlots() < numSlots() && slot < numSlots() - numFixedSlots();
    3871             :     }
    3872             :     MDefinition* getDynamicSlot(uint32_t slot) const {
    3873           0 :         return getSlot(slot + numFixedSlots());
    3874             :     }
    3875           0 :     void setDynamicSlot(uint32_t slot, MDefinition* def) {
    3876           0 :         setSlot(slot + numFixedSlots(), def);
    3877           0 :     }
    3878             : 
    3879             :     // Interface reserved for unboxed objects.
    3880             :     bool hasOffset(uint32_t offset) const {
    3881             :         MOZ_ASSERT(isUnboxed());
    3882             :         return offset < operandIndex_->map.length() && operandIndex_->map[offset] != 0;
    3883             :     }
    3884             :     MDefinition* getOffset(uint32_t offset) const {
    3885           1 :         return getOperand(operandIndex_->map[offset]);
    3886             :     }
    3887           1 :     void setOffset(uint32_t offset, MDefinition* def) {
    3888           1 :         replaceOperand(operandIndex_->map[offset], def);
    3889           1 :     }

    4062             : 
    4063             : // WrappedFunction wraps a JSFunction so it can safely be used off-thread.
    4064             : // In particular, a function's flags can be modified on the active thread as
    4065             : // functions are relazified and delazified, so we must be careful not to access
    4066             : // these flags off-thread.
    4067             : class WrappedFunction : public TempObject
    4068             : {
    4069             :     CompilerFunction fun_;
    4070             :     uint16_t nargs_;
    4071             :     bool isNative_ : 1;
    4072             :     bool isConstructor_ : 1;
    4073             :     bool isClassConstructor_ : 1;
    4074             :     bool isSelfHostedBuiltin_ : 1;
    4075             : 
    4076             :   public:
    4077             :     explicit WrappedFunction(JSFunction* fun);
    4078           1 :     size_t nargs() const { return nargs_; }
    4079           1 :     bool isNative() const { return isNative_; }
    4080             :     bool isConstructor() const { return isConstructor_; }
    4081           1 :     bool isClassConstructor() const { return isClassConstructor_; }
    4082           1 :     bool isSelfHostedBuiltin() const { return isSelfHostedBuiltin_; }
    4083             : 
    4084             :     // fun->native() and fun->jitInfo() can safely be called off-thread: these
    4085             :     // fields never change.
    4086           1 :     JSNative native() const { return fun_->native(); }
    4087           1 :     const JSJitInfo* jitInfo() const { return fun_->jitInfo(); }
    4088             : 
    4089           1 :     JSFunction* rawJSFunction() const { return fun_; }
    4090             : 
    4091             :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const {
    4092           1 :         return roots.append(fun_);
    4093             :     }
    4094             : };
    4095             : 
    4096             : class MCall
    4097             :   : public MVariadicInstruction,
    4098             :     public CallPolicy::Data
    4099             : {
    4100             :   private:
    4101             :     // An MCall uses the MPrepareCall, MDefinition for the function, and
    4102             :     // MPassArg instructions. They are stored in the same list.
    4103             :     static const size_t FunctionOperandIndex   = 0;
    4104             :     static const size_t NumNonArgumentOperands = 1;
    4105             : 
    4106             :   protected:
    4107             :     // Monomorphic cache of single target from TI, or nullptr.
    4108             :     WrappedFunction* target_;
    4109             : 
    4110             :     // Original value of argc from the bytecode.
    4111             :     uint32_t numActualArgs_;
    4112             : 
    4113             :     // True if the call is for JSOP_NEW.
    4114             :     bool construct_:1;
    4115             : 
    4116             :     // True if the caller does not use the return value.
    4117             :     bool ignoresReturnValue_:1;
    4118             : 
    4119             :     bool needsArgCheck_:1;
    4120             : 
    4121             :     MCall(WrappedFunction* target, uint32_t numActualArgs, bool construct, bool ignoresReturnValue)
    4122             :       : target_(target),
    4123             :         numActualArgs_(numActualArgs),
    4124             :         construct_(construct),
    4125             :         ignoresReturnValue_(ignoresReturnValue),
    4126           1 :         needsArgCheck_(true)
    4127             :     {
    4128           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
    4129             :     }
    4130             : 
    4131             :   public:
    4132           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Call)
    4133             :     static MCall* New(TempAllocator& alloc, JSFunction* target, size_t maxArgc, size_t numActualArgs,
    4134             :                       bool construct, bool ignoresReturnValue, bool isDOMCall);
    4135             : 
    4136             :     void initFunction(MDefinition* func) {
    4137           1 :         initOperand(FunctionOperandIndex, func);
    4138             :     }
    4139             : 
    4140             :     bool needsArgCheck() const {
    4141           1 :         return needsArgCheck_;
    4142             :     }
    4143             : 
    4144             :     void disableArgCheck() {
    4145           1 :         needsArgCheck_ = false;
    4146             :     }
    4147             :     MDefinition* getFunction() const {
    4148           1 :         return getOperand(FunctionOperandIndex);
    4149             :     }
    4150             :     void replaceFunction(MInstruction* newfunc) {
    4151           1 :         replaceOperand(FunctionOperandIndex, newfunc);
    4152             :     }
    4153             : 
    4154             :     void addArg(size_t argnum, MDefinition* arg);
    4155             : 
    4156             :     MDefinition* getArg(uint32_t index) const {
    4157           1 :         return getOperand(NumNonArgumentOperands + index);
    4158             :     }
    4159             : 
    4160             :     static size_t IndexOfThis() {
    4161             :         return NumNonArgumentOperands;
    4162             :     }
    4163             :     static size_t IndexOfArgument(size_t index) {
    4164             :         return NumNonArgumentOperands + index + 1; // +1 to skip |this|.
    4165             :     }
    4166             :     static size_t IndexOfStackArg(size_t index) {
    4167           1 :         return NumNonArgumentOperands + index;
    4168             :     }
    4169             : 
    4170             :     // For TI-informed monomorphic callsites.
    4171             :     WrappedFunction* getSingleTarget() const {
    4172             :         return target_;
    4173             :     }
    4174             : 
    4175             :     bool isConstructing() const {
    4176           1 :         return construct_;
    4177             :     }
    4178             : 
    4179             :     bool ignoresReturnValue() const {
    4180           1 :         return ignoresReturnValue_;
    4181             :     }
    4182             : 
    4183             :     // The number of stack arguments is the max between the number of formal
    4184             :     // arguments and the number of actual arguments. The number of stack
    4185             :     // argument includes the |undefined| padding added in case of underflow.
    4186             :     // Includes |this|.
    4187             :     uint32_t numStackArgs() const {
    4188           1 :         return numOperands() - NumNonArgumentOperands;
    4189             :     }
    4190             : 
    4191             :     // Does not include |this|.
    4192             :     uint32_t numActualArgs() const {
    4193             :         return numActualArgs_;
    4194             :     }
    4195             : 
    4196           1 :     bool possiblyCalls() const override {
    4197           1 :         return true;
    4198             :     }
    4199             : 
    4200           1 :     virtual bool isCallDOMNative() const {
    4201           1 :         return false;
    4202             :     }
    4203             : 
    4204             :     // A method that can be called to tell the MCall to figure out whether it's
    4205             :     // movable or not.  This can't be done in the constructor, because it
    4206             :     // depends on the arguments to the call, and those aren't passed to the
    4207             :     // constructor but are set up later via addArg.
    4208           1 :     virtual void computeMovable() {
    4209           1 :     }
    4210             : 
    4211           1 :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const override {
    4212           1 :         if (target_)
    4213           1 :             return target_->appendRoots(roots);
    4214             :         return true;
    4215             :     }
    4216             : };
    4217             : 
    4218             : class MCallDOMNative : public MCall
    4219             : {
    4220             :     // A helper class for MCalls for DOM natives.  Note that this is NOT
    4221             :     // actually a separate MIR op from MCall, because all sorts of places use
    4222             :     // isCall() to check for calls and all we really want is to overload a few
    4223             :     // virtual things from MCall.
    4224             :   protected:
    4225           1 :     MCallDOMNative(WrappedFunction* target, uint32_t numActualArgs)
    4226           1 :         : MCall(target, numActualArgs, false, false)
    4227             :     {
    4228             :         MOZ_ASSERT(getJitInfo()->type() != JSJitInfo::InlinableNative);
    4229             : 
    4230             :         // If our jitinfo is not marked eliminatable, that means that our C++
    4231             :         // implementation is fallible or that it never wants to be eliminated or
    4232             :         // that we have no hope of ever doing the sort of argument analysis that
    4233             :         // would allow us to detemine that we're side-effect-free.  In the
    4234             :         // latter case we wouldn't get DCEd no matter what, but for the former
    4235             :         // two cases we have to explicitly say that we can't be DCEd.
    4236           1 :         if (!getJitInfo()->isEliminatable)
    4237           1 :             setGuard();
    4238           1 :     }
    4239             : 
    4240             :     friend MCall* MCall::New(TempAllocator& alloc, JSFunction* target, size_t maxArgc,
    4241             :                              size_t numActualArgs, bool construct, bool ignoresReturnValue,
    4242             :                              bool isDOMCall);
    4243             : 
    4244             :     const JSJitInfo* getJitInfo() const;
    4245             :   public:
    4246             :     virtual AliasSet getAliasSet() const override;
    4247             : 
    4248             :     virtual bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override;
    4249             : 
    4250           1 :     virtual bool isCallDOMNative() const override {
    4251           1 :         return true;
    4252             :     }
    4253             : 
    4254             :     virtual void computeMovable() override;
    4255             : };

    4318             : 
    4319             :     // For TI-informed monomorphic callsites.
    4320             :     WrappedFunction* getSingleTarget() const {
    4321             :         return target_;
    4322             :     }
    4323             : 
    4324           1 :     bool possiblyCalls() const override {

    4518           0 : class MCompare
    4519             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    4520             :     public ComparePolicy::Data
    4521             : {
    4522             :   public:
    4523             :     enum CompareType {
    4524             : 
    4525             :         // Anything compared to Undefined
    4526             :         Compare_Undefined,
    4527             : 
    4528             :         // Anything compared to Null
    4529             :         Compare_Null,
    4530             : 
    4531             :         // Undefined compared to Boolean
    4532             :         // Null      compared to Boolean
    4533             :         // Double    compared to Boolean
    4534             :         // String    compared to Boolean
    4535             :         // Symbol    compared to Boolean
    4536             :         // Object    compared to Boolean
    4537             :         // Value     compared to Boolean
    4538             :         Compare_Boolean,
    4539             : 
    4540             :         // Int32   compared to Int32
    4541             :         // Boolean compared to Boolean
    4542             :         Compare_Int32,
    4543             :         Compare_Int32MaybeCoerceBoth,
    4544             :         Compare_Int32MaybeCoerceLHS,
    4545             :         Compare_Int32MaybeCoerceRHS,
    4546             : 
    4547             :         // Int32 compared as unsigneds
    4548             :         Compare_UInt32,
    4549             : 
    4550             :         // Int64 compared to Int64.
    4551             :         Compare_Int64,
    4552             : 
    4553             :         // Int64 compared as unsigneds.
    4554             :         Compare_UInt64,
    4555             : 
    4556             :         // Double compared to Double
    4557             :         Compare_Double,
    4558             : 
    4559             :         Compare_DoubleMaybeCoerceLHS,
    4560             :         Compare_DoubleMaybeCoerceRHS,
    4561             : 
    4562             :         // Float compared to Float
    4563             :         Compare_Float32,
    4564             : 
    4565             :         // String compared to String
    4566             :         Compare_String,
    4567             : 
    4568             :         // Symbol compared to Symbol
    4569             :         Compare_Symbol,
    4570             : 
    4571             :         // Undefined compared to String
    4572             :         // Null      compared to String
    4573             :         // Boolean   compared to String
    4574             :         // Int32     compared to String
    4575             :         // Double    compared to String
    4576             :         // Object    compared to String
    4577             :         // Value     compared to String
    4578             :         Compare_StrictString,
    4579             : 
    4580             :         // Object compared to Object
    4581             :         Compare_Object,
    4582             : 
    4583             :         // Compare 2 values bitwise
    4584             :         Compare_Bitwise,
    4585             : 
    4586             :         // All other possible compares
    4587             :         Compare_Unknown
    4588             :     };
    4589             : 
    4590             :   private:
    4591             :     CompareType compareType_;
    4592             :     JSOp jsop_;
    4593             :     bool operandMightEmulateUndefined_;
    4594             :     bool operandsAreNeverNaN_;
    4595             : 
    4596             :     // When a floating-point comparison is converted to an integer comparison
    4597             :     // (when range analysis proves it safe), we need to convert the operands
    4598             :     // to integer as well.
    4599             :     bool truncateOperands_;
    4600             : 
    4601             :     MCompare(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right, JSOp jsop)
    4602             :       : MBinaryInstruction(left, right),
    4603             :         compareType_(Compare_Unknown),
    4604             :         jsop_(jsop),
    4605             :         operandMightEmulateUndefined_(true),
    4606             :         operandsAreNeverNaN_(false),
    4607           1 :         truncateOperands_(false)
    4608             :     {
    4609           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Boolean);
    4610           1 :         setMovable();
    4611             :     }
    4612             :

    4616             :         MOZ_ASSERT(compareType == Compare_Int32 || compareType == Compare_UInt32 ||
    4617             :                    compareType == Compare_Int64 || compareType == Compare_UInt64 ||
    4618             :                    compareType == Compare_Double || compareType == Compare_Float32);

    4716             : // Takes a typed value and returns an untyped value.
    4717           0 : class MBox
    4718             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    4719             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    4720             : {
    4721           1 :     MBox(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* ins)
    4722           1 :       : MUnaryInstruction(ins)
    4723             :     {
    4724           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
    4725           1 :         if (ins->resultTypeSet()) {
    4726           1 :             setResultTypeSet(ins->resultTypeSet());
    4727           1 :         } else if (ins->type() != MIRType::Value) {
    4728           1 :             TypeSet::Type ntype = ins->type() == MIRType::Object
    4729             :                                   ? TypeSet::AnyObjectType()
    4730           1 :                                   : TypeSet::PrimitiveType(ValueTypeFromMIRType(ins->type()));
    4731           1 :             setResultTypeSet(alloc.lifoAlloc()->new_<TemporaryTypeSet>(alloc.lifoAlloc(), ntype));
    4732             :         }
    4733           1 :         setMovable();
    4734           1 :     }
    4735             :

    4739             :     {
    4740             :         // Cannot box a box.
    4741             :         MOZ_ASSERT(ins->type() != MIRType::Value);
    4742             : 
    4743           1 :         return new(alloc) MBox(alloc, ins);
    4744             :     }
    4745             : 
    4746           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    4747           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);

    4749           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    4750           1 :         return AliasSet::None();

    4754             : };
    4755             : 
    4756             : // Note: the op may have been inverted during lowering (to put constants in a
    4757             : // position where they can be immediates), so it is important to use the
    4758             : // lir->jsop() instead of the mir->jsop() when it is present.
    4759             : static inline Assembler::Condition
    4760             : JSOpToCondition(MCompare::CompareType compareType, JSOp op)
    4761             : {
    4762           1 :     bool isSigned = (compareType != MCompare::Compare_UInt32);
    4763           1 :     return JSOpToCondition(op, isSigned);
    4764             : }
    4765             : 
    4766             : // Takes a typed value and checks if it is a certain type. If so, the payload
    4767             : // is unpacked and returned as that type. Otherwise, it is considered a
    4768             : // deoptimization.
    4769           0 : class MUnbox final : public MUnaryInstruction, public BoxInputsPolicy::Data
    4770             : {
    4771             :   public:
    4772             :     enum Mode {
    4773             :         Fallible,       // Check the type, and deoptimize if unexpected.
    4774             :         Infallible,     // Type guard is not necessary.
    4775             :         TypeBarrier     // Guard on the type, and act like a TypeBarrier on failure.
    4776             :     };
    4777             : 
    4778             :   private:
    4779             :     Mode mode_;
    4780             :     BailoutKind bailoutKind_;
    4781             : 
    4782           1 :     MUnbox(MDefinition* ins, MIRType type, Mode mode, BailoutKind kind, TempAllocator& alloc)
    4783             :       : MUnaryInstruction(ins),
    4784           1 :         mode_(mode)
    4785             :     {
    4786             :         // Only allow unboxing a non MIRType::Value when input and output types
    4787             :         // don't match. This is often used to force a bailout. Boxing happens
    4788             :         // during type analysis.
    4789             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(ins->type() != MIRType::Value, type != ins->type());
    4790             : 
    4791             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type == MIRType::Boolean ||
    4792             :                    type == MIRType::Int32   ||
    4793             :                    type == MIRType::Double  ||
    4794             :                    type == MIRType::String  ||
    4795             :                    type == MIRType::Symbol  ||
    4796             :                    type == MIRType::Object);
    4797             : 
    4798           1 :         TemporaryTypeSet* resultSet = ins->resultTypeSet();
    4799           1 :         if (resultSet && type == MIRType::Object)
    4800           1 :             resultSet = resultSet->cloneObjectsOnly(alloc.lifoAlloc());
    4801             : 
    4802           1 :         setResultType(type);
    4803           1 :         setResultTypeSet(resultSet);
    4804           1 :         setMovable();
    4805             : 
    4806           1 :         if (mode_ == TypeBarrier || mode_ == Fallible)
    4807           1 :             setGuard();
    4808             : 
    4809           1 :         bailoutKind_ = kind;
    4810           1 :     }
    4811             :   public:
    4812           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Unbox)
    4813           1 :     static MUnbox* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* ins, MIRType type, Mode mode)
    4814             :     {
    4815             :         // Unless we were given a specific BailoutKind, pick a default based on
    4816             :         // the type we expect.
    4817             :         BailoutKind kind;
    4818           1 :         switch (type) {
    4819             :           case MIRType::Boolean:
    4820             :             kind = Bailout_NonBooleanInput;
    4821             :             break;
    4822             :           case MIRType::Int32:
    4823           1 :             kind = Bailout_NonInt32Input;
    4824           1 :             break;
    4825             :           case MIRType::Double:
    4826           1 :             kind = Bailout_NonNumericInput; // Int32s are fine too
    4827           1 :             break;
    4828             :           case MIRType::String:
    4829           1 :             kind = Bailout_NonStringInput;
    4830           1 :             break;
    4831             :           case MIRType::Symbol:
    4832           1 :             kind = Bailout_NonSymbolInput;
    4833           1 :             break;
    4834             :           case MIRType::Object:
    4835           1 :             kind = Bailout_NonObjectInput;
    4836           1 :             break;
    4837             :           default:
    4838           0 :             MOZ_CRASH("Given MIRType cannot be unboxed.");
    4839             :         }
    4840             : 
    4841           1 :         return new(alloc) MUnbox(ins, type, mode, kind, alloc);
    4842             :     }
    4843             : 
    4844             :     static MUnbox* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* ins, MIRType type, Mode mode,
    4845             :                        BailoutKind kind)
    4846             :     {
    4847             :         return new(alloc) MUnbox(ins, type, mode, kind, alloc);
    4848             :     }
    4849             : 
    4850             :     Mode mode() const {
    4851             :         return mode_;
    4852             :     }
    4853             :     BailoutKind bailoutKind() const {
    4854             :         // If infallible, no bailout should be generated.
    4855             :         MOZ_ASSERT(fallible());
    4856             :         return bailoutKind_;
    4857             :     }
    4858             :     bool fallible() const {
    4859           1 :         return mode() != Infallible;
    4860             :     }
    4861           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    4862           1 :         if (!ins->isUnbox() || ins->toUnbox()->mode() != mode())
    4863             :             return false;
    4864           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
    4865             :     }
    4866             : 
    4867             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    4868             : 
    4869           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    4870           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    4871             :     }
    4872             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    4873             :     void makeInfallible() {
    4874             :         // Should only be called if we're already Infallible or TypeBarrier
    4875             :         MOZ_ASSERT(mode() != Fallible);
    4876           1 :         mode_ = Infallible;
    4877             :     }
    4878             :

    5226             : // Converts a primitive (either typed or untyped) to a double. If the input is
    5227             : // not primitive at runtime, a bailout occurs.
    5228           0 : class MToDouble
    5229             :   : public MToFPInstruction
    5230             : {
    5231             :   private:
    5232             :     TruncateKind implicitTruncate_;
    5233             : 
    5234           1 :     explicit MToDouble(MDefinition* def, ConversionKind conversion = NonStringPrimitives)
    5235           1 :       : MToFPInstruction(def, conversion), implicitTruncate_(NoTruncate)
    5236             :     {
    5237           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Double);
    5238           1 :         setMovable();
    5239             : 
    5240             :         // An object might have "valueOf", which means it is effectful.
    5241             :         // ToNumber(symbol) throws.
    5242           1 :         if (def->mightBeType(MIRType::Object) || def->mightBeType(MIRType::Symbol))
    5243           1 :             setGuard();
    5244           1 :     }
    5245             : 
    5246             :   public:
    5247           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(ToDouble)
    5248           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    5249             : 
    5250             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    5251           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    5252           1 :         if (!ins->isToDouble() || ins->toToDouble()->conversion() != conversion())
    5253             :             return false;
    5254           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
    5255             :     }
    5256           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    5257           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    5258             :     }
    5259             : 
    5260             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;

    5264             : 
    5265             : #ifdef DEBUG
    5266             :     bool isConsistentFloat32Use(MUse* use) const override { return true; }
    5267             : #endif
    5268             : 
    5269             :     TruncateKind truncateKind() const {
    5270             :         return implicitTruncate_;
    5271             :     }
    5272             :     void setTruncateKind(TruncateKind kind) {
    5273           1 :         implicitTruncate_ = Max(implicitTruncate_, kind);
    5274             :     }
    5275             : 
    5276             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const override;
    5277           1 :     bool canRecoverOnBailout() const override {
    5278           1 :         if (input()->type() == MIRType::Value)
    5279             :             return false;
    5280           1 :         if (input()->type() == MIRType::Symbol)
    5281             :             return false;
    5282             : 
    5283           1 :         return true;
    5284             :     }
    5285             : 
    5286           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MToDouble)
    5287             : };

    5289             : // Converts a primitive (either typed or untyped) to a float32. If the input is

    5305             :         // ToNumber(symbol) throws.

    5307           0 :             setGuard();

    5314             :     }

    5317           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(ToFloat32)
    5318           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    5319             : 
    5320             :     virtual MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    5321           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    5322           1 :         if (!congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins))
    5323             :             return false;

    5574             : // Converts a primitive (either typed or untyped) to an int32. If the input is
    5575             : // not primitive at runtime, a bailout occurs. If the input cannot be converted
    5576             : // to an int32 without loss (i.e. "5.5" or undefined) then a bailout occurs.
    5577           0 : class MToInt32
    5578             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    5579             :     public ToInt32Policy::Data

    5591           1 :         setMovable();

    5594             :         // ToNumber(symbol) throws.
    5595           1 :         if (def->mightBeType(MIRType::Object) || def->mightBeType(MIRType::Symbol))
    5596           1 :             setGuard();

    5959           0 : class MBitAnd : public MBinaryBitwiseInstruction
    5960             : {
    5961             :     MBitAnd(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right, MIRType type)
    5962           1 :       : MBinaryBitwiseInstruction(left, right, type)
    5963             :     { }
    5964             : 
    5965             :   public:
    5966           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(BitAnd)
    5967             :     static MBitAnd* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right);
    5968             :     static MBitAnd* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right, MIRType type);
    5969             : 
    5970           0 :     MDefinition* foldIfZero(size_t operand) override {
    5971           0 :         return getOperand(operand); // 0 & x => 0;
    5972             :     }
    5973           0 :     MDefinition* foldIfNegOne(size_t operand) override {
    5974           0 :         return getOperand(1 - operand); // x & -1 => x
    5975             :     }
    5976           0 :     MDefinition* foldIfEqual() override {
    5977           0 :         return getOperand(0); // x & x => x;
    5978             :     }
    5979           1 :     MDefinition* foldIfAllBitsSet(size_t operand) override {
    5980             :         // e.g. for uint16: x & 0xffff => x;
    5981           1 :         return getOperand(1 - operand);
    5982             :     }
    5983             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    5984             : 
    5985             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const override;
    5986           1 :     bool canRecoverOnBailout() const override {
    5987           1 :         return specialization_ != MIRType::None;
    5988             :     }
    5989             : 
    5990           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MBitAnd)
    5991             : };
