    6207             : 
    6208           1 : class MBinaryArithInstruction
    6209             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    6210             :     public ArithPolicy::Data
    6211             : {
    6212             :     // Implicit truncate flag is set by the truncate backward range analysis
    6213             :     // optimization phase, and by wasm pre-processing. It is used in
    6214             :     // NeedNegativeZeroCheck to check if the result of a multiplication needs to
    6215             :     // produce -0 double value, and for avoiding overflow checks.
    6216             : 
    6217             :     // This optimization happens when the multiplication cannot be truncated
    6218             :     // even if all uses are truncating its result, such as when the range
    6219             :     // analysis detect a precision loss in the multiplication.
    6220             :     TruncateKind implicitTruncate_;
    6221             : 
    6222             :     // Whether we must preserve NaN semantics, and in particular not fold
    6223             :     // (x op id) or (id op x) to x, or replace a division by a multiply of the
    6224             :     // exact reciprocal.
    6225             :     bool mustPreserveNaN_;
    6226             : 
    6227             :   public:
    6228             :     MBinaryArithInstruction(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right)
    6229             :       : MBinaryInstruction(left, right),
    6230             :         implicitTruncate_(NoTruncate),
    6231           1 :         mustPreserveNaN_(false)
    6232             :     {
    6233           1 :         specialization_ = MIRType::None;
    6234           1 :         setMovable();
    6235             :     }
    6236             : 
    6237             :     static MBinaryArithInstruction* New(TempAllocator& alloc, Opcode op,
    6238             :                                         MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right);
    6239             : 
    6240             :     bool constantDoubleResult(TempAllocator& alloc);
    6241             : 
    6242           1 :     void setMustPreserveNaN(bool b) { mustPreserveNaN_ = b; }
    6243             :     bool mustPreserveNaN() const { return mustPreserveNaN_; }
    6244             : 
    6245             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    6246             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    6247             : 
    6248             :     virtual double getIdentity() = 0;
    6249             : 
    6250             :     void setSpecialization(MIRType type) {
    6251           1 :         specialization_ = type;
    6252           1 :         setResultType(type);
    6253             :     }
    6254             :     void setInt32Specialization() {
    6255           1 :         specialization_ = MIRType::Int32;
    6256           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Int32);
    6257             :     }
    6258             :     void setNumberSpecialization(TempAllocator& alloc, BaselineInspector* inspector, jsbytecode* pc);
    6259             : 
    6260             :     virtual void trySpecializeFloat32(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    6261             : 
    6262           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    6263           1 :         if (!binaryCongruentTo(ins))
    6264             :             return false;
    6265           1 :         const auto* other = static_cast<const MBinaryArithInstruction*>(ins);
    6266           1 :         return other->mustPreserveNaN_ == mustPreserveNaN_;
    6267             :     }
    6268           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    6269           1 :         if (specialization_ >= MIRType::Object)
    6270             :             return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::Any);
    6271             :         return AliasSet::None();
    6272             :     }
    6273             : 
    6274             :     bool isTruncated() const {
    6275             :         return implicitTruncate_ == Truncate;
    6276             :     }
    6277             :     TruncateKind truncateKind() const {
    6278             :         return implicitTruncate_;
    6279             :     }
    6280             :     void setTruncateKind(TruncateKind kind) {
    6281           1 :         implicitTruncate_ = Max(implicitTruncate_, kind);
    6282             :     }
    6283             : };
    6284             :

    6955           0 : class MMul : public MBinaryArithInstruction
    6956             : {
    6957             :   public:
    6958             :     enum Mode {
    6959             :         Normal,
    6960             :         Integer
    6961             :     };
    6962             : 
    6963             :   private:
    6964             :     // Annotation the result could be a negative zero
    6965             :     // and we need to guard this during execution.
    6966             :     bool canBeNegativeZero_;
    6967             : 
    6968             :     Mode mode_;
    6969             : 
    6970           1 :     MMul(MDefinition* left, MDefinition* right, MIRType type, Mode mode)
    6971             :       : MBinaryArithInstruction(left, right),
    6972             :         canBeNegativeZero_(true),
    6973           1 :         mode_(mode)
    6974             :     {
    6975           1 :         if (mode == Integer) {
    6976             :             // This implements the required behavior for Math.imul, which
    6977             :             // can never fail and always truncates its output to int32.
    6978           1 :             canBeNegativeZero_ = false;
    6979           1 :             setTruncateKind(Truncate);
    6980           1 :             setCommutative();
    6981             :         }
    6982             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(mode != Integer, mode == Normal);
    6983             : 
    6984           1 :         if (type != MIRType::Value)
    6985           1 :             specialization_ = type;
    6986           1 :         setResultType(type);
    6987           1 :     }
    6988             : 
    6989             :   public:
    6990           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Mul)

    6993             :     }

    6998             :     }

    7004             :         return ret;
    7005             :     }

    7011             : 
    7012           1 :     double getIdentity() override {
    7013           1 :         return 1;
    7014             :     }

    7016           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    7017           1 :         if (!ins->isMul())
    7018             :             return false;
    7019             : 
    7020           1 :         const MMul* mul = ins->toMul();
    7021           1 :         if (canBeNegativeZero_ != mul->canBeNegativeZero())
    7022             :             return false;
    7023             : 
    7024           1 :         if (mode_ != mul->mode())
    7025             :             return false;
    7026             : 
    7027           1 :         if (mustPreserveNaN() != mul->mustPreserveNaN())
    7028             :             return false;
    7029             : 
    7030           1 :         return binaryCongruentTo(ins);
    7031             :     }

    7036             :         return canBeNegativeZero_;
    7037             :     }

    7039           1 :         canBeNegativeZero_ = negativeZero;
    7040             :     }
    7041             :

    7043             :

    7045           1 :         return canBeNegativeZero_ || canOverflow();

    7049           0 :         specialization_ = type;
    7050             :     }

    7069           0 : class MDiv : public MBinaryArithInstruction
    7070             : {
    7071             :     bool canBeNegativeZero_;

    7107           1 :         div->unsigned_ = unsignd;
    7108           1 :         div->trapOnError_ = trapOnError;
    7109           1 :         div->bytecodeOffset_ = bytecodeOffset;
    7110           1 :         if (trapOnError) {
    7111           0 :             div->setGuard(); // not removable because of possible side-effects.
    7112           0 :             div->setNotMovable();
    7113             :         }
    7114           1 :         div->setMustPreserveNaN(mustPreserveNaN);
    7115           1 :         if (type == MIRType::Int32)
    7116           1 :             div->setTruncateKind(Truncate);
    7117           1 :         return div;
    7118             :     }
    7119             : 
    7120             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    7121             :     void analyzeEdgeCasesForward() override;
    7122             :     void analyzeEdgeCasesBackward() override;
    7123             : 
    7124           0 :     double getIdentity() override {
    7125           0 :         MOZ_CRASH("not used");
    7126             :     }
    7127             : 
    7128             :     bool canBeNegativeZero() const {
    7129             :         return canBeNegativeZero_;
    7130             :     }
    7131             :     void setCanBeNegativeZero(bool negativeZero) {
    7132           1 :         canBeNegativeZero_ = negativeZero;
    7133             :     }
    7134             : 
    7135             :     bool canBeNegativeOverflow() const {
    7136             :         return canBeNegativeOverflow_;
    7137             :     }
    7138             : 
    7139             :     bool canBeDivideByZero() const {
    7140             :         return canBeDivideByZero_;
    7141             :     }
    7142             : 
    7143             :     bool canBeNegativeDividend() const {
    7144             :         // "Dividend" is an ambiguous concept for unsigned truncated
    7145             :         // division, because of the truncation procedure:
    7146             :         // ((x>>>0)/2)|0, for example, gets transformed in
    7147             :         // MDiv::truncate into a node with lhs representing x (not
    7148             :         // x>>>0) and rhs representing the constant 2; in other words,
    7149             :         // the MIR node corresponds to "cast operands to unsigned and
    7150             :         // divide" operation. In this case, is the dividend x or is it
    7151             :         // x>>>0? In order to resolve such ambiguities, we disallow
    7152             :         // the usage of this method for unsigned division.
    7153             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!unsigned_);
    7154             :         return canBeNegativeDividend_;
    7155             :     }
    7156             : 
    7157             :     bool isUnsigned() const {
    7158             :         return unsigned_;
    7159             :     }
    7160             : 
    7161             :     bool isTruncatedIndirectly() const {
    7162           1 :         return truncateKind() >= IndirectTruncate;
    7163             :     }
    7164             : 
    7165             :     bool canTruncateInfinities() const {
    7166           1 :         return isTruncated();
    7167             :     }
    7168             :     bool canTruncateRemainder() const {
    7169           1 :         return isTruncated();
    7170             :     }
    7171             :     bool canTruncateOverflow() const {
    7172           1 :         return isTruncated() || isTruncatedIndirectly();
    7173             :     }
    7174             :     bool canTruncateNegativeZero() const {
    7175           1 :         return isTruncated() || isTruncatedIndirectly();
    7176             :     }
    7177             : 
    7178             :     bool trapOnError() const {
    7179             :         return trapOnError_;
    7180             :     }
    7181             :     wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset() const {
    7182             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bytecodeOffset_.isValid());
    7183             :         return bytecodeOffset_;
    7184             :     }

    7186           1 :     bool isFloat32Commutative() const override { return true; }
    7187             :

    7192             :     void collectRangeInfoPreTrunc() override;

    7196           1 :     bool canRecoverOnBailout() const override {
    7197           1 :         return specialization_ < MIRType::Object;
    7198             :     }

    7200           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    7201           1 :         if (!MBinaryArithInstruction::congruentTo(ins))
    7202             :             return false;

    7557             : class MPhi final
    7558             :   : public MDefinition,
    7559             :     public InlineListNode<MPhi>,
    7560             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    7561             : {
    7562             :     using InputVector = js::Vector<MUse, 2, JitAllocPolicy>;
    7563             :     InputVector inputs_;
    7564             : 
    7565             :     TruncateKind truncateKind_;
    7566             :     bool hasBackedgeType_;
    7567             :     bool triedToSpecialize_;
    7568             :     bool isIterator_;

    7570             :     bool canConsumeFloat32_;
    7571             : 
    7572             : #if DEBUG
    7573             :     bool specialized_;
    7574             : #endif
    7575             : 
    7576             :   protected:
    7577           0 :     MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) override {
    7578             :         // Note: after the initial IonBuilder pass, it is OK to change phi
    7579             :         // operands such that they do not include the type sets of their
    7580             :         // operands. This can arise during e.g. value numbering, where
    7581             :         // definitions producing the same value may have different type sets.
    7582             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index < numOperands());
    7583           0 :         return &inputs_[index];
    7584             :     }
    7585           0 :     const MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) const override {
    7586           0 :         return &inputs_[index];
    7587             :     }
    7588             : 
    7589             :   public:
    7590           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER_WITHOUT_TYPEPOLICY(Phi)
    7591             :     virtual TypePolicy* typePolicy();
    7592             :     virtual MIRType typePolicySpecialization();
    7593             : 
    7594           1 :     MPhi(TempAllocator& alloc, MIRType resultType)
    7595             :       : inputs_(alloc),
    7596             :         truncateKind_(NoTruncate),
    7597             :         hasBackedgeType_(false),
    7598             :         triedToSpecialize_(false),
    7599             :         isIterator_(false),
    7600             :         canProduceFloat32_(false),

    7604             : #endif

    7607           1 :     }

    7610           1 :         return new(alloc) MPhi(alloc, resultType);
    7611             :     }

    7613           1 :         return new(alloc) MPhi(alloc.alloc, resultType);
    7614             :     }
    7615             : 
    7616             :     void removeOperand(size_t index);
    7617             :     void removeAllOperands();
    7618             : 
    7619           1 :     MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const override {
    7620           1 :         return inputs_[index].producer();
    7621             :     }
    7622           1 :     size_t numOperands() const override {
    7623           1 :         return inputs_.length();
    7624             :     }
    7625           1 :     size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const final override {
    7626             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u >= &inputs_[0]);
    7627             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u <= &inputs_[numOperands() - 1]);
    7628           1 :         return u - &inputs_[0];
    7629             :     }
    7630           1 :     void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) final override {
    7631           1 :         inputs_[index].replaceProducer(operand);
    7632           1 :     }
    7633             :     bool hasBackedgeType() const {
    7634             :         return hasBackedgeType_;
    7635             :     }
    7636             :     bool triedToSpecialize() const {
    7637             :         return triedToSpecialize_;
    7638             :     }
    7639             :     void specialize(MIRType type) {
    7640           1 :         triedToSpecialize_ = true;
    7641           1 :         setResultType(type);
    7642             :     }
    7643             :     bool specializeType(TempAllocator& alloc);
    7644             : 
    7645             : #ifdef DEBUG
    7646             :     // Assert that this is a phi in a loop header with a unique predecessor and
    7647             :     // a unique backedge.
    7648             :     void assertLoopPhi() const;
    7649             : #else
    7650             :     void assertLoopPhi() const {}
    7651             : #endif
    7652             : 
    7653             :     // Assuming this phi is in a loop header with a unique loop entry, return
    7654             :     // the phi operand along the loop entry.
    7655             :     MDefinition* getLoopPredecessorOperand() const {
    7656           1 :         assertLoopPhi();
    7657             :         return getOperand(0);
    7658             :     }
    7659             : 
    7660             :     // Assuming this phi is in a loop header with a unique loop entry, return
    7661             :     // the phi operand along the loop backedge.
    7662             :     MDefinition* getLoopBackedgeOperand() const {
    7663           1 :         assertLoopPhi();
    7664             :         return getOperand(1);
    7665             :     }
    7666             : 
    7667             :     // Whether this phi's type already includes information for def.
    7668             :     bool typeIncludes(MDefinition* def);
    7669             : 
    7670             :     // Add types for this phi which speculate about new inputs that may come in
    7671             :     // via a loop backedge.
    7672             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addBackedgeType(TempAllocator& alloc, MIRType type,
    7673             :                                       TemporaryTypeSet* typeSet);
    7674             : 
    7675             :     // Initializes the operands vector to the given capacity,
    7676             :     // permitting use of addInput() instead of addInputSlow().
    7677             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool reserveLength(size_t length) {
    7678           1 :         return inputs_.reserve(length);
    7679             :     }
    7680             : 
    7681             :     // Use only if capacity has been reserved by reserveLength
    7682             :     void addInput(MDefinition* ins) {
    7683           1 :         inputs_.infallibleEmplaceBack(ins, this);
    7684             :     }
    7685             : 
    7686             :     // Appends a new input to the input vector. May perform reallocation.
    7687             :     // Prefer reserveLength() and addInput() instead, where possible.
    7688             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addInputSlow(MDefinition* ins) {
    7689           1 :         return inputs_.emplaceBack(ins, this);
    7690             :     }
    7691             : 
    7692             :     // Appends a new input to the input vector. Infallible because
    7693             :     // we know the inputs fits in the vector's inline storage.
    7694             :     void addInlineInput(MDefinition* ins) {
    7695             :         MOZ_ASSERT(inputs_.length() < InputVector::InlineLength);
    7696             :         MOZ_ALWAYS_TRUE(addInputSlow(ins));
    7697             :     }
    7698             : 
    7699             :     // Update the type of this phi after adding |ins| as an input. Set
    7700             :     // |*ptypeChange| to true if the type changed.
    7701             :     bool checkForTypeChange(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* ins, bool* ptypeChange);
    7702             : 
    7703             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    7704             :     MDefinition* foldsTernary(TempAllocator& alloc);

    7707             :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override;
    7708             : 
    7709             :     bool isIterator() const {
    7710             :         return isIterator_;
    7711             :     }
    7712             :     void setIterator() {
    7713           1 :         isIterator_ = true;
    7714             :     }
    7715             : 
    7716           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    7717           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    7718             :     }
    7719             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;

    7743             : 
    7744             : // The goal of a Beta node is to split a def at a conditionally taken
    7745             : // branch, so that uses dominated by it have a different name.
    7746             : class MBeta
    7747             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    7748             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    7749             : {
    7750             :   private:
    7751             :     // This is the range induced by a comparison and branch in a preceding
    7752             :     // block. Note that this does not reflect any range constraints from
    7753             :     // the input value itself, so this value may differ from the range()
    7754             :     // range after it is computed.
    7755             :     const Range* comparison_;
    7756             : 
    7757           1 :     MBeta(MDefinition* val, const Range* comp)
    7758             :         : MUnaryInstruction(val),
    7759           1 :           comparison_(comp)
    7760             :     {
    7761           1 :         setResultType(val->type());
    7762           1 :         setResultTypeSet(val->resultTypeSet());
    7763           1 :     }
    7764             : 
    7765             :   public:
    7766           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Beta)
    7767           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    7768             : 
    7769             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
    7770             : 
    7771           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    7772           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
    7773             :     }
    7774             : 
    7775             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    7776             : };

    8456             : 
    8457             : struct LambdaFunctionInfo
    8458             : {
    8459             :     // The functions used in lambdas are the canonical original function in
    8460             :     // the script, and are immutable except for delazification. Record this
    8461             :     // information while still on the active thread to avoid races.
    8462             :     CompilerFunction fun;
    8463             :     uint16_t flags;
    8464             :     uint16_t nargs;
    8465             :     gc::Cell* scriptOrLazyScript;
    8466             :     bool singletonType;
    8467             :     bool useSingletonForClone;
    8468             : 
    8469           1 :     explicit LambdaFunctionInfo(JSFunction* fun)
    8470           1 :       : fun(fun), flags(fun->flags()), nargs(fun->nargs()),
    8471             :         scriptOrLazyScript(fun->hasScript()
    8472             :                            ? (gc::Cell*) fun->nonLazyScript()
    8473             :                            : (gc::Cell*) fun->lazyScript()),
    8474           1 :         singletonType(fun->isSingleton()),
    8475           1 :         useSingletonForClone(ObjectGroup::useSingletonForClone(fun))
    8476           1 :     {}
    8477             : 
    8478           1 :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const {
    8479           1 :         if (!roots.append(fun))
    8480             :             return false;
    8481           1 :         if (fun->hasScript())
    8482           1 :             return roots.append(fun->nonLazyScript());
    8483           1 :         return roots.append(fun->lazyScript());
    8484             :     }
    8485             : 
    8486             :   private:
    8487             :     LambdaFunctionInfo(const LambdaFunctionInfo&) = delete;
    8488             :     void operator=(const LambdaFunctionInfo&) = delete;
    8489             : };
    8490             : 
    8491             : class MLambda
    8492             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    8493             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
    8494             : {
    8495             :     const LambdaFunctionInfo info_;
    8496             : 
    8497           1 :     MLambda(CompilerConstraintList* constraints, MDefinition* envChain, MConstant* cst)
    8498           1 :       : MBinaryInstruction(envChain, cst), info_(&cst->toObject().as<JSFunction>())
    8499             :     {
    8500           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Object);
    8501           1 :         if (!info().fun->isSingleton() && !ObjectGroup::useSingletonForClone(info().fun))
    8502           1 :             setResultTypeSet(MakeSingletonTypeSet(constraints, info().fun));
    8503           1 :     }
    8504             : 
    8505             :   public:
    8506           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(Lambda)
    8507           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    8508           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, environmentChain))
    8509             : 
    8510             :     MConstant* functionOperand() const {
    8511           1 :         return getOperand(1)->toConstant();
    8512             :     }
    8513             :     const LambdaFunctionInfo& info() const {
    8514           1 :         return info_;
    8515             :     }
    8516             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const override;
    8517           1 :     bool canRecoverOnBailout() const override {
    8518           1 :         return true;
    8519             :     }

    8521           1 :         return info_.appendRoots(roots);
    8522             :     }
    8523             : };

    8680             : // Passes through an object's elements, after ensuring it is entirely doubles.
    8681             : class MConvertElementsToDoubles
    8682             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    8683             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
    8684             : {
    8685           1 :     explicit MConvertElementsToDoubles(MDefinition* elements)
    8686           1 :       : MUnaryInstruction(elements)
    8687             :     {
    8688           1 :         setGuard();
    8689           1 :         setMovable();
    8690           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Elements);
    8691           1 :     }
    8692             : 
    8693             :   public:
    8694           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(ConvertElementsToDoubles)
    8695           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    8696           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, elements))
    8697             : 
    8698           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    8699           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
    8700             :     }
    8701           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    8702             :         // This instruction can read and write to the elements' contents.
    8703             :         // However, it is alright to hoist this from loops which explicitly
    8704             :         // read or write to the elements: such reads and writes will use double
    8705             :         // values and can be reordered freely wrt this conversion, except that
    8706             :         // definite double loads must follow the conversion. The latter
    8707             :         // property is ensured by chaining this instruction with the elements
    8708             :         // themselves, in the same manner as MBoundsCheck.
    8709           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    8710             :     }
    8711             : };
    8712             : 
    8713             : // If |elements| has the CONVERT_DOUBLE_ELEMENTS flag, convert value to
    8714             : // double. Else return the original value.

    8753           1 :         setResultTypeSet(object->resultTypeSet());
    8754           1 :     }

    8760             : 
    8761             :     bool checkNative() const {
    8762             :         return checkNative_;
    8763             :     }
    8764           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    8765           0 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins) &&
    8766           0 :                checkNative() == ins->toMaybeCopyElementsForWrite()->checkNative();
    8767             :     }
    8768           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    8769           1 :         return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::ObjectFields);
    8770             :     }
    8771             : #ifdef DEBUG
    8772             :     bool needsResumePoint() const override {
    8773             :         // This instruction is idempotent and does not change observable
    8774             :         // behavior, so does not need its own resume point.
    8775             :         return false;
    8776             :     }
    8777             : #endif
    8778             :

    8800             :     }

    9241             : 
    9242             : // Bailout if index + minimum < 0 or index + maximum >= length. The length used
    9243             : // in a bounds check must not be negative, or the wrong result may be computed
    9244             : // (unsigned comparisons may be used).
    9245           0 : class MBoundsCheck
    9246             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    9247             :     public MixPolicy<IntPolicy<0>, IntPolicy<1>>::Data
    9248             : {
    9249             :     // Range over which to perform the bounds check, may be modified by GVN.
    9250             :     int32_t minimum_;
    9251             :     int32_t maximum_;
    9252             :     bool fallible_;
    9253             : 
    9254           1 :     MBoundsCheck(MDefinition* index, MDefinition* length)
    9255           1 :       : MBinaryInstruction(index, length), minimum_(0), maximum_(0), fallible_(true)
    9256             :     {
    9257           1 :         setGuard();
    9258           1 :         setMovable();
    9259             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index->type() == MIRType::Int32);
    9260             :         MOZ_ASSERT(length->type() == MIRType::Int32);
    9261             : 
    9262             :         // Returns the checked index.
    9263           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Int32);
    9264           1 :     }
    9265             : 
    9266             :   public:
    9267           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(BoundsCheck)
    9268           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    9269           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, index), (1, length))
    9270             : 
    9271             :     int32_t minimum() const {
    9272             :         return minimum_;
    9273             :     }
    9274             :     void setMinimum(int32_t n) {
    9275             :         MOZ_ASSERT(fallible_);
    9276           1 :         minimum_ = n;
    9277             :     }
    9278             :     int32_t maximum() const {
    9279             :         return maximum_;
    9280             :     }
    9281             :     void setMaximum(int32_t n) {
    9282             :         MOZ_ASSERT(fallible_);
    9283           1 :         maximum_ = n;
    9284             :     }
    9285             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    9286           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    9287           1 :         if (!ins->isBoundsCheck())
    9288             :             return false;
    9289           1 :         const MBoundsCheck* other = ins->toBoundsCheck();
    9290           1 :         if (minimum() != other->minimum() || maximum() != other->maximum())
    9291             :             return false;
    9292           1 :         if (fallible() != other->fallible())
    9293             :             return false;
    9294           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
    9295             :     }
    9296           1 :     virtual AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    9297           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    9298             :     }
    9299             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    9300             :     bool fallible() const {
    9301             :         return fallible_;
    9302             :     }
    9303             :     void collectRangeInfoPreTrunc() override;
    9304             : 
    9305           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MBoundsCheck)
    9306             : };
    9307             : 
    9308             : // Bailout if index < minimum.
    9309             : class MBoundsCheckLower
    9310             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    9311             :     public IntPolicy<0>::Data
    9312             : {
    9313             :     int32_t minimum_;
    9314             :     bool fallible_;

    9318             :     {

    9320           1 :         setMovable();

    9322           1 :     }

    9324             :   public:
    9325           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(BoundsCheckLower)
    9326           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    9327           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, index))
    9328             : 
    9329             :     int32_t minimum() const {
    9330             :         return minimum_;
    9331             :     }
    9332             :     void setMinimum(int32_t n) {
    9333           1 :         minimum_ = n;
    9334             :     }
    9335           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    9336           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    9337             :     }
    9338             :     bool fallible() const {
    9339             :         return fallible_;
    9340             :     }
    9341             :     void collectRangeInfoPreTrunc() override;
    9342             : };
    9343             : 
    9344             : // Instructions which access an object's elements can either do so on a
    9345             : // definition accessing that elements pointer, or on the object itself, if its
    9346             : // elements are inline. In the latter case there must be an offset associated
    9347             : // with the access.
    9348             : static inline bool
    9349             : IsValidElementsType(MDefinition* elements, int32_t offsetAdjustment)
    9350             : {
    9351             :     return elements->type() == MIRType::Elements ||
    9352             :            (elements->type() == MIRType::Object && offsetAdjustment != 0);
    9353             : }
    9354             : 
    9355             : // Load a value from a dense array's element vector and does a hole check if the
    9356             : // array is not known to be packed.
    9357           0 : class MLoadElement
    9358             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
    9359             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
    9360             : {
    9361             :     bool needsHoleCheck_;
    9362             :     bool loadDoubles_;
    9363             :     int32_t offsetAdjustment_;
    9364             : 
    9365           1 :     MLoadElement(MDefinition* elements, MDefinition* index,
    9366             :                  bool needsHoleCheck, bool loadDoubles, int32_t offsetAdjustment = 0)
    9367             :       : MBinaryInstruction(elements, index),
    9368             :         needsHoleCheck_(needsHoleCheck),
    9369             :         loadDoubles_(loadDoubles),
    9370           1 :         offsetAdjustment_(offsetAdjustment)
    9371             :     {
    9372           1 :         if (needsHoleCheck) {
    9373             :             // Uses may be optimized away based on this instruction's result
    9374             :             // type. This means it's invalid to DCE this instruction, as we
    9375             :             // have to invalidate when we read a hole.
    9376           1 :             setGuard();
    9377             :         }
    9378           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
    9379           1 :         setMovable();
    9380             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsValidElementsType(elements, offsetAdjustment));
    9381             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index->type() == MIRType::Int32);
    9382           1 :     }
    9383             : 
    9384             :   public:
    9385           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(LoadElement)
    9386           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    9387           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, elements), (1, index))
    9388             : 
    9389             :     bool needsHoleCheck() const {
    9390             :         return needsHoleCheck_;
    9391             :     }
    9392             :     bool loadDoubles() const {
    9393             :         return loadDoubles_;
    9394             :     }
    9395             :     int32_t offsetAdjustment() const {
    9396             :         return offsetAdjustment_;
    9397             :     }
    9398             :     bool fallible() const {
    9399           1 :         return needsHoleCheck();
    9400             :     }
    9401           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    9402           1 :         if (!ins->isLoadElement())
    9403             :             return false;
    9404           1 :         const MLoadElement* other = ins->toLoadElement();
    9405           1 :         if (needsHoleCheck() != other->needsHoleCheck())
    9406             :             return false;
    9407           1 :         if (loadDoubles() != other->loadDoubles())
    9408             :             return false;
    9409           1 :         if (offsetAdjustment() != other->offsetAdjustment())
    9410             :             return false;
    9411           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
    9412             :     }
    9413             :     AliasType mightAlias(const MDefinition* store) const override;
    9414             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
    9415           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    9416           1 :         return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::Element);
    9417             :     }
    9418             : 
    9419           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MLoadElement)
    9420             : };
    9421             : 
    9422             : // Load a value from the elements vector for a dense native or unboxed array.
    9423             : // If the index is out-of-bounds, or the indexed slot has a hole, undefined is
    9424             : // returned instead.
    9425           0 : class MLoadElementHole
    9426             :   : public MTernaryInstruction,
    9427             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
    9428             : {
    9429             :     // Unboxed element type, JSVAL_TYPE_MAGIC for dense native elements.
    9430             :     JSValueType unboxedType_;

    9441             :     {
    9442           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
    9443           1 :         setMovable();

    9446             :         // index. We can clear this flag (and needsNegativeIntCheck_) in
    9447             :         // collectRangeInfoPreTrunc.
    9448           1 :         setGuard();

    9489           0 : class MLoadUnboxedObjectOrNull

    9492             : {
    9493             :   public:
    9494             :     enum NullBehavior {
    9495             :         HandleNull,
    9496             :         BailOnNull,
    9497             :         NullNotPossible
    9498             :     };

    9500             :   private:
    9501             :     NullBehavior nullBehavior_;

    9540             :             return false;

    9661             : 
    9662             : // Like MStoreElement, but supports indexes >= initialized length, and can
    9663             : // handle unboxed arrays. The downside is that we cannot hoist the elements
    9664             : // vector and bounds check, since this instruction may update the (initialized)
    9665             : // length and reallocate the elements vector.
    9666           0 : class MStoreElementHole
    9667             :   : public MAryInstruction<4>,
    9668             :     public MStoreElementCommon,
    9669             :     public MixPolicy<SingleObjectPolicy, NoFloatPolicy<3> >::Data
    9670             : {
    9671             :     JSValueType unboxedType_;

    9674             :                       MDefinition* index, MDefinition* value, JSValueType unboxedType)

    9676             :     {
    9677           1 :         initOperand(0, object);
    9678           1 :         initOperand(1, elements);
    9679           1 :         initOperand(2, index);
    9680           1 :         initOperand(3, value);
    9681             :         MOZ_ASSERT(elements->type() == MIRType::Elements);
    9682             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index->type() == MIRType::Int32);
    9683           1 :     }
    9684             : 
    9685             :   public:
    9686           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(StoreElementHole)
    9687           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
    9688           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, object), (1, elements), (2, index), (3, value))
    9689             :

    9691             :         return unboxedType_;
    9692             :     }
    9693           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    9694             :         // StoreElementHole can update the initialized length, the array length
    9695             :         // or reallocate obj->elements.
    9696             :         return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::ObjectFields |
    9697           1 :                                AliasSet::BoxedOrUnboxedElements(unboxedType()));
    9698             :     }
    9699             : 
    9700           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MStoreElementHole)
    9701             : };

    9828             : 
    9829             : // Passes through an object, after ensuring it is converted from an unboxed
    9830             : // object to a native representation.
    9831             : class MConvertUnboxedObjectToNative
    9832             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
    9833             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
    9834             : {
    9835             :     CompilerObjectGroup group_;
    9836             : 
    9837           1 :     explicit MConvertUnboxedObjectToNative(MDefinition* obj, ObjectGroup* group)
    9838             :       : MUnaryInstruction(obj),
    9839           1 :         group_(group)
    9840             :     {
    9841           1 :         setGuard();
    9842           1 :         setMovable();
    9843           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Object);
    9844           1 :     }
    9845             : 
    9846             :   public:
    9847           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(ConvertUnboxedObjectToNative)
    9848           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, object))
    9849             : 
    9850             :     static MConvertUnboxedObjectToNative* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* obj,
    9851             :                                               ObjectGroup* group);
    9852             : 
    9853             :     ObjectGroup* group() const {
    9854           1 :         return group_;
    9855             :     }
    9856           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
    9857           1 :         if (!congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins))
    9858             :             return false;
    9859           1 :         return ins->toConvertUnboxedObjectToNative()->group() == group();
    9860             :     }
    9861           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
    9862             :         // This instruction can read and write to all parts of the object, but
    9863             :         // is marked as non-effectful so it can be consolidated by LICM and GVN
    9864             :         // and avoid inhibiting other optimizations.
    9865             :         //
    9866             :         // This is valid to do because when unboxed objects might have a native
    9867             :         // group they can be converted to, we do not optimize accesses to the
    9868             :         // unboxed objects and do not guard on their group or shape (other than
    9869             :         // in this opcode).
    9870             :         //
    9871             :         // Later accesses can assume the object has a native representation
    9872             :         // and optimize accordingly. Those accesses cannot be reordered before
    9873             :         // this instruction, however. This is prevented by chaining this
    9874             :         // instruction with the object itself, in the same way as MBoundsCheck.
    9875           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
    9876             :     }

   10027             :         // Array.join might coerce the elements of the Array to strings.  This

   10033             : 
   10034             : // All barriered operations - MCompareExchangeTypedArrayElement,
   10035             : // MExchangeTypedArrayElement, and MAtomicTypedArrayElementBinop, as
   10036             : // well as MLoadUnboxedScalar and MStoreUnboxedScalar when they are
   10037             : // marked as requiring a memory barrer - have the following
   10038             : // attributes:
   10039             : //
   10040             : // - Not movable
   10041             : // - Not removable
   10042             : // - Not congruent with any other instruction
   10043             : // - Effectful (they alias every TypedArray store)
   10044             : //
   10045             : // The intended effect of those constraints is to prevent all loads
   10046             : // and stores preceding the barriered operation from being moved to
   10047             : // after the barriered operation, and vice versa, and to prevent the
   10048             : // barriered operation from being removed or hoisted.
   10049             : 
   10050             : enum MemoryBarrierRequirement
   10051             : {
   10052             :     DoesNotRequireMemoryBarrier,
   10053             :     DoesRequireMemoryBarrier
   10054             : };
   10055             : 
   10056             : // Also see comments at MMemoryBarrierRequirement, above.
   10057             : 
   10058             : // Load an unboxed scalar value from a typed array or other object.
   10059           0 : class MLoadUnboxedScalar
   10060             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
   10061             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
   10062             : {
   10063             :     Scalar::Type storageType_;
   10064             :     Scalar::Type readType_;
   10065             :     unsigned numElems_; // used only for SIMD
   10066             :     bool requiresBarrier_;
   10067             :     int32_t offsetAdjustment_;
   10068             :     bool canonicalizeDoubles_;
   10069             : 
   10070           1 :     MLoadUnboxedScalar(MDefinition* elements, MDefinition* index, Scalar::Type storageType,
   10071             :                        MemoryBarrierRequirement requiresBarrier = DoesNotRequireMemoryBarrier,
   10072             :                        int32_t offsetAdjustment = 0, bool canonicalizeDoubles = true)
   10073             :       : MBinaryInstruction(elements, index),
   10074             :         storageType_(storageType),
   10075             :         readType_(storageType),
   10076             :         numElems_(1),
   10077           1 :         requiresBarrier_(requiresBarrier == DoesRequireMemoryBarrier),
   10078             :         offsetAdjustment_(offsetAdjustment),
   10079           1 :         canonicalizeDoubles_(canonicalizeDoubles)
   10080             :     {
   10081           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
   10082           1 :         if (requiresBarrier_)
   10083           0 :             setGuard();         // Not removable or movable
   10084             :         else
   10085           1 :             setMovable();
   10086             :         MOZ_ASSERT(IsValidElementsType(elements, offsetAdjustment));
   10087             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index->type() == MIRType::Int32);
   10088             :         MOZ_ASSERT(storageType >= 0 && storageType < Scalar::MaxTypedArrayViewType);
   10089           1 :     }
   10090             : 
   10091             :   public:
   10092           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(LoadUnboxedScalar)

   10098           0 :         numElems_ = numElems;

   10101             :         return numElems_;
   10102             :     }

   10104             :         return readType_;
   10105             :     }
   10106             : 
   10107             :     Scalar::Type storageType() const {
   10108             :         return storageType_;
   10109             :     }
   10110             :     bool fallible() const {
   10111             :         // Bailout if the result does not fit in an int32.
   10112           1 :         return readType_ == Scalar::Uint32 && type() == MIRType::Int32;
   10113             :     }
   10114             :     bool requiresMemoryBarrier() const {
   10115             :         return requiresBarrier_;
   10116             :     }
   10117             :     bool canonicalizeDoubles() const {
   10118             :         return canonicalizeDoubles_;
   10119             :     }
   10120             :     int32_t offsetAdjustment() const {
   10121             :         return offsetAdjustment_;
   10122             :     }
   10123             :     void setOffsetAdjustment(int32_t offsetAdjustment) {
   10124           0 :         offsetAdjustment_ = offsetAdjustment;
   10125             :     }
   10126           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   10127             :         // When a barrier is needed make the instruction effectful by
   10128             :         // giving it a "store" effect.
   10129           1 :         if (requiresBarrier_)
   10130             :             return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::UnboxedElement);
   10131             :         return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::UnboxedElement);
   10132             :     }
   10133             : 
   10134           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   10135           1 :         if (requiresBarrier_)
   10136             :             return false;
   10137           1 :         if (!ins->isLoadUnboxedScalar())
   10138             :             return false;
   10139           1 :         const MLoadUnboxedScalar* other = ins->toLoadUnboxedScalar();
   10140           1 :         if (storageType_ != other->storageType_)
   10141             :             return false;
   10142           1 :         if (readType_ != other->readType_)
   10143             :             return false;
   10144           1 :         if (numElems_ != other->numElems_)
   10145             :             return false;
   10146           1 :         if (offsetAdjustment() != other->offsetAdjustment())
   10147             :             return false;
   10148           1 :         if (canonicalizeDoubles() != other->canonicalizeDoubles())
   10149             :             return false;
   10150           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
   10151             :     }
   10152             : 
   10153             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
   10154             : 
   10155             :     void computeRange(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
   10156             : 
   10157           1 :     bool canProduceFloat32() const override { return storageType_ == Scalar::Float32; }
   10158             : 
   10159           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MLoadUnboxedScalar)
   10160             : };

   10426             :                    "arrayType == writeType iff the write type isn't SIMD");
   10427           0 :         return writeType();

   10708             : {

   10776             : class MGetPropertyCache
   10777             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
   10778             :     public MixPolicy<BoxExceptPolicy<0, MIRType::Object>, CacheIdPolicy<1>>::Data

   10787             :         idempotent_(false),
   10788             :         monitoredResult_(monitoredResult),
   10789           1 :         inlinePropertyTable_(nullptr)
   10790             :     {
   10791           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
   10792             : 
   10793             :         // The cache will invalidate if there are objects with e.g. lookup or
   10794             :         // resolve hooks on the proto chain. setGuard ensures this check is not
   10795             :         // eliminated.
   10796           1 :         setGuard();
   10797             :     }
   10798             : 
   10799             :   public:
   10800           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(GetPropertyCache)

   10803             : 
   10804           1 :     InlinePropertyTable* initInlinePropertyTable(TempAllocator& alloc, jsbytecode* pc) {
   10805             :         MOZ_ASSERT(inlinePropertyTable_ == nullptr);
   10806           1 :         inlinePropertyTable_ = new(alloc) InlinePropertyTable(alloc, pc);
   10807           1 :         return inlinePropertyTable_;
   10808             :     }
   10809             : 
   10810             :     void clearInlinePropertyTable() {
   10811           1 :         inlinePropertyTable_ = nullptr;
   10812             :     }

   10814             :     InlinePropertyTable* propTable() const {
   10815             :         return inlinePropertyTable_;

   10819           1 :         return idempotent_;

   10822           1 :         idempotent_ = true;

   10824             :     }
   10825             :     bool monitoredResult() const {
   10826           1 :         return monitoredResult_;
   10827             :     }
   10828             : 
   10829           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   10830           1 :         if (!idempotent_)
   10831             :             return false;
   10832           1 :         if (!ins->isGetPropertyCache())
   10833             :             return false;
   10834           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
   10835             :     }

   10837           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   10838           1 :         if (idempotent_) {
   10839             :             return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::ObjectFields |
   10840             :                                   AliasSet::FixedSlot |
   10841             :                                   AliasSet::DynamicSlot);
   10842             :         }
   10843             :         return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::Any);
   10844             :     }
   10845             : 
   10846             :     bool allowDoubleResult() const;

   10848           1 :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const override {
   10849           1 :         if (inlinePropertyTable_)
   10850           1 :             return inlinePropertyTable_->appendRoots(roots);
   10851             :         return true;
   10852             :     }
   10853             : };
   10854             : 
   10855           1 : struct PolymorphicEntry {
   10856             :     // The group and/or shape to guard against.
   10857             :     ReceiverGuard receiver;
   10858             : 
   10859             :     // The property to load, null for loads from unboxed properties.
   10860             :     Shape* shape;
   10861             : 
   10862           1 :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const {
   10863           1 :         return roots.append(receiver) && roots.append(shape);
   10864             :     }
   10865             : };
   10866             : 
   10867             : // Emit code to load a value from an object if it matches one of the receivers
   10868             : // observed by the baseline IC, else bails out.
   10869             : class MGetPropertyPolymorphic
   10870             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
   10871             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
   10872             : {
   10873             :     Vector<PolymorphicEntry, 4, JitAllocPolicy> receivers_;
   10874             :     CompilerPropertyName name_;
   10875             : 
   10876           1 :     MGetPropertyPolymorphic(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* obj, PropertyName* name)
   10877             :       : MUnaryInstruction(obj),
   10878             :         receivers_(alloc),
   10879           1 :         name_(name)
   10880             :     {
   10881           1 :         setGuard();
   10882           1 :         setMovable();
   10883           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
   10884           1 :     }
   10885             : 
   10886             :   public:
   10887           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(GetPropertyPolymorphic)
   10888           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, object))
   10889             : 
   10890           1 :     static MGetPropertyPolymorphic* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* obj, PropertyName* name) {
   10891           1 :         return new(alloc) MGetPropertyPolymorphic(alloc, obj, name);
   10892             :     }
   10893             : 
   10894           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   10895           1 :         if (!ins->isGetPropertyPolymorphic())
   10896             :             return false;
   10897           1 :         if (name() != ins->toGetPropertyPolymorphic()->name())
   10898             :             return false;
   10899           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
   10900             :     }
   10901             : 
   10902           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addReceiver(const ReceiverGuard& receiver, Shape* shape) {
   10903             :         PolymorphicEntry entry;
   10904           1 :         entry.receiver = receiver;
   10905           1 :         entry.shape = shape;
   10906           1 :         return receivers_.append(entry);
   10907             :     }
   10908             :     size_t numReceivers() const {
   10909           1 :         return receivers_.length();
   10910             :     }
   10911             :     const ReceiverGuard receiver(size_t i) const {
   10912           1 :         return receivers_[i].receiver;
   10913             :     }
   10914             :     Shape* shape(size_t i) const {
   10915           1 :         return receivers_[i].shape;
   10916             :     }
   10917             :     PropertyName* name() const {
   10918           1 :         return name_;
   10919             :     }
   10920           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   10921           1 :         bool hasUnboxedLoad = false;
   10922           1 :         for (size_t i = 0; i < numReceivers(); i++) {
   10923           1 :             if (!shape(i)) {
   10924             :                 hasUnboxedLoad = true;
   10925             :                 break;
   10926             :             }
   10927             :         }
   10928             :         return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::ObjectFields |
   10929             :                               AliasSet::FixedSlot |
   10930             :                               AliasSet::DynamicSlot |
   10931           1 :                               (hasUnboxedLoad ? AliasSet::UnboxedElement : 0));
   10932             :     }
   10933             : 
   10934             :     AliasType mightAlias(const MDefinition* store) const override;
   10935             : 
   10936             :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const override;
   10937             : };
   10938             : 
   10939             : // Emit code to store a value to an object's slots if its shape/group matches
   10940             : // one of the shapes/groups observed by the baseline IC, else bails out.
   10941             : class MSetPropertyPolymorphic
   10942             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
   10943             :     public MixPolicy<SingleObjectPolicy, NoFloatPolicy<1> >::Data
   10944             : {
   10945             :     Vector<PolymorphicEntry, 4, JitAllocPolicy> receivers_;
   10946             :     CompilerPropertyName name_;
   10947             :     bool needsBarrier_;
   10948             : 
   10949           1 :     MSetPropertyPolymorphic(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* obj, MDefinition* value,
   10950             :                             PropertyName* name)

   10956           1 :     }

   10986             :         return needsBarrier_;

   10989           1 :         needsBarrier_ = true;
   10990             :     }

   10992           1 :         bool hasUnboxedStore = false;

   11006             : 
   11007             : class MDispatchInstruction
   11008             :   : public MControlInstruction,
   11009             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
   11010             : {
   11011             :     // Map from JSFunction* -> MBasicBlock.
   11012             :     struct Entry {
   11013             :         JSFunction* func;
   11014             :         // If |func| has a singleton group, |funcGroup| is null. Otherwise,
   11015             :         // |funcGroup| holds the ObjectGroup for |func|, and dispatch guards
   11016             :         // on the group instead of directly on the function.
   11017             :         ObjectGroup* funcGroup;
   11018             :         MBasicBlock* block;
   11019             : 
   11020             :         Entry(JSFunction* func, ObjectGroup* funcGroup, MBasicBlock* block)
   11021           1 :           : func(func), funcGroup(funcGroup), block(block)
   11022             :         { }
   11023           1 :         bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const {
   11024           1 :             return roots.append(func) && roots.append(funcGroup);
   11025             :         }
   11026             :     };
   11027             :     Vector<Entry, 4, JitAllocPolicy> map_;
   11028             : 
   11029             :     // An optional fallback path that uses MCall.
   11030             :     MBasicBlock* fallback_;
   11031             :     MUse operand_;
   11032             : 
   11033             :     void initOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) {
   11034             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
   11035           1 :         operand_.init(operand, this);
   11036             :     }
   11037             : 
   11038             :   public:
   11039             :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, input))
   11040           1 :     MDispatchInstruction(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* input)
   11041           1 :       : map_(alloc), fallback_(nullptr)
   11042             :     {
   11043           1 :         initOperand(0, input);
   11044           1 :     }
   11045             : 
   11046             :   protected:
   11047           1 :     MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) final override {
   11048             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
   11049           1 :         return &operand_;
   11050             :     }
   11051           0 :     const MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) const final override {
   11052             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
   11053           0 :         return &operand_;
   11054             :     }
   11055           1 :     MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const final override {
   11056             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
   11057           1 :         return operand_.producer();
   11058             :     }
   11059           1 :     size_t numOperands() const final override {
   11060           1 :         return 1;
   11061             :     }
   11062           0 :     size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const final override {
   11063             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u == getUseFor(0));
   11064           0 :         return 0;
   11065             :     }
   11066           0 :     void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) final override {
   11067             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index == 0);
   11068           0 :         operand_.replaceProducer(operand);
   11069           0 :     }
   11070             : 
   11071             :   public:
   11072             :     void setSuccessor(size_t i, MBasicBlock* successor) {
   11073             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numSuccessors());
   11074           1 :         if (i == map_.length())
   11075           1 :             fallback_ = successor;
   11076             :         else
   11077           0 :             map_[i].block = successor;
   11078             :     }
   11079           1 :     size_t numSuccessors() const final override {
   11080           1 :         return map_.length() + (fallback_ ? 1 : 0);
   11081             :     }
   11082           1 :     void replaceSuccessor(size_t i, MBasicBlock* successor) final override {
   11083             :         setSuccessor(i, successor);
   11084           1 :     }
   11085           1 :     MBasicBlock* getSuccessor(size_t i) const final override {
   11086             :         MOZ_ASSERT(i < numSuccessors());
   11087           1 :         if (i == map_.length())
   11088           1 :             return fallback_;
   11089           1 :         return map_[i].block;
   11090             :     }
   11091             : 
   11092             :   public:
   11093           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool addCase(JSFunction* func, ObjectGroup* funcGroup, MBasicBlock* block) {
   11094           1 :         return map_.append(Entry(func, funcGroup, block));
   11095             :     }
   11096             :     uint32_t numCases() const {
   11097           1 :         return map_.length();
   11098             :     }
   11099             :     JSFunction* getCase(uint32_t i) const {
   11100           1 :         return map_[i].func;
   11101             :     }
   11102             :     ObjectGroup* getCaseObjectGroup(uint32_t i) const {
   11103           1 :         return map_[i].funcGroup;
   11104             :     }
   11105             :     MBasicBlock* getCaseBlock(uint32_t i) const {
   11106           1 :         return map_[i].block;
   11107             :     }
   11108             : 
   11109             :     bool hasFallback() const {
   11110             :         return bool(fallback_);
   11111             :     }
   11112             :     void addFallback(MBasicBlock* block) {
   11113             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!hasFallback());
   11114           1 :         fallback_ = block;
   11115             :     }
   11116             :     MBasicBlock* getFallback() const {
   11117             :         MOZ_ASSERT(hasFallback());
   11118             :         return fallback_;
   11119             :     }
   11120             :     bool appendRoots(MRootList& roots) const override;
   11121             : };

   11245             :         // guard on, and guarding on the shape can interact badly with

   11254             :

   11256           1 :         return shape_;

   11259             :         return bailoutKind_;

   11262           1 :         if (!ins->isGuardShape())

   11496             : // Load an unboxed plain object's expando.
   11497             : class MLoadUnboxedExpando
   11498             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
   11499             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
   11500             : {
   11501             :   private:
   11502           1 :     explicit MLoadUnboxedExpando(MDefinition* object)
   11503           1 :       : MUnaryInstruction(object)
   11504             :     {
   11505           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Object);
   11506           1 :         setMovable();
   11507           1 :     }
   11508             : 
   11509             :   public:
   11510           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(LoadUnboxedExpando)
   11511           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
   11512           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, object))
   11513             : 
   11514           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   11515           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
   11516             :     }
   11517           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   11518           1 :         return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::ObjectFields);
   11519             :     }
   11520             : };
   11521             : 
   11522             : // Load from vp[slot] (slots that are not inline in an object).
   11523           0 : class MLoadSlot
   11524             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
   11525             :     public SingleObjectPolicy::Data
   11526             : {
   11527             :     uint32_t slot_;
   11528             : 
   11529           1 :     MLoadSlot(MDefinition* slots, uint32_t slot)
   11530             :       : MUnaryInstruction(slots),
   11531           1 :         slot_(slot)
   11532             :     {
   11533           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
   11534           1 :         setMovable();
   11535             :         MOZ_ASSERT(slots->type() == MIRType::Slots);
   11536           1 :     }
   11537             : 
   11538             :   public:
   11539           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(LoadSlot)
   11540           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
   11541           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, slots))
   11542             : 
   11543             :     uint32_t slot() const {
   11544             :         return slot_;
   11545             :     }
   11546             : 
   11547             :     HashNumber valueHash() const override;
   11548           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   11549           1 :         if (!ins->isLoadSlot())
   11550             :             return false;
   11551           1 :         if (slot() != ins->toLoadSlot()->slot())
   11552             :             return false;
   11553           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
   11554             :     }
   11555             : 
   11556             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
   11557             : 
   11558           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   11559             :         MOZ_ASSERT(slots()->type() == MIRType::Slots);
   11560           1 :         return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::DynamicSlot);
   11561             :     }
   11562             :     AliasType mightAlias(const MDefinition* store) const override;
   11563             : 
   11564             :     void printOpcode(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
   11565             : 
   11566           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MLoadSlot)
   11567             : };

   11912             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,

   11931           1 :         return name_;

   11933             : 
   11934             :     // Constructors need to perform a GetProp on the function prototype.
   11935             :     // Since getters cannot be set on the prototype, fetching is non-effectful.
   11936             :     // The operation may be safely repeated in case of bailout.
   11937             :     void setIdempotent() {
   11938           1 :         idempotent_ = true;
   11939             :     }
   11940           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   11941           1 :         if (!idempotent_)
   11942             :             return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::Any);
   11943             :         return AliasSet::None();
   11944             :     }
   11945           1 :     bool possiblyCalls() const override {
   11946           1 :         return true;
   11947             :     }

   11949           1 :         return roots.append(name_);
   11950             :     }
   11951             : };

   12039             : class MGetDOMProperty
   12040             :   : public MVariadicInstruction,
   12041             :     public ObjectPolicy<0>::Data
   12042             : {
   12043             :     const JSJitInfo* info_;
   12044             : 
   12045             :   protected:
   12046           1 :     explicit MGetDOMProperty(const JSJitInfo* jitinfo)
   12047           1 :       : info_(jitinfo)
   12048             :     {
   12049             :         MOZ_ASSERT(jitinfo);
   12050             :         MOZ_ASSERT(jitinfo->type() == JSJitInfo::Getter);
   12051             : 
   12052             :         // We are movable iff the jitinfo says we can be.
   12053           1 :         if (isDomMovable()) {
   12054             :             MOZ_ASSERT(jitinfo->aliasSet() != JSJitInfo::AliasEverything);
   12055           1 :             setMovable();
   12056             :         } else {
   12057             :             // If we're not movable, that means we shouldn't be DCEd either,
   12058             :             // because we might throw an exception when called, and getting rid
   12059             :             // of that is observable.
   12060           1 :             setGuard();
   12061             :         }
   12062             : 
   12063           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
   12064           1 :     }
   12065             : 
   12066             :     const JSJitInfo* info() const {
   12067             :         return info_;
   12068             :     }
   12069             : 
   12070           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool init(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* obj, MDefinition* guard,
   12071             :                            MDefinition* globalGuard) {
   12072             :         MOZ_ASSERT(obj);
   12073             :         // guard can be null.
   12074             :         // globalGuard can be null.
   12075           1 :         size_t operandCount = 1;
   12076           1 :         if (guard)
   12077           1 :             ++operandCount;
   12078           1 :         if (globalGuard)
   12079           1 :             ++operandCount;
   12080           1 :         if (!MVariadicInstruction::init(alloc, operandCount))
   12081             :             return false;
   12082           1 :         initOperand(0, obj);
   12083             : 
   12084           1 :         size_t operandIndex = 1;
   12085             :         // Pin the guard, if we have one as an operand if we want to hoist later.
   12086           1 :         if (guard)
   12087           1 :             initOperand(operandIndex++, guard);
   12088             : 
   12089             :         // And the same for the global guard, if we have one.
   12090           1 :         if (globalGuard)
   12091           1 :             initOperand(operandIndex, globalGuard);
   12092             : 
   12093             :         return true;
   12094             :     }
   12095             : 
   12096             :   public:
   12097           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(GetDOMProperty)
   12098           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, object))
   12099             : 
   12100           1 :     static MGetDOMProperty* New(TempAllocator& alloc, const JSJitInfo* info, MDefinition* obj,
   12101             :                                 MDefinition* guard, MDefinition* globalGuard)
   12102             :     {
   12103           1 :         auto* res = new(alloc) MGetDOMProperty(info);
   12104           1 :         if (!res || !res->init(alloc, obj, guard, globalGuard))
   12105             :             return nullptr;
   12106           1 :         return res;
   12107             :     }
   12108             : 
   12109             :     JSJitGetterOp fun() const {
   12110           1 :         return info_->getter;
   12111             :     }

   12113           1 :         return info_->isInfallible;
   12114             :     }

   12116           1 :         return info_->isMovable;
   12117             :     }

   12122             :         MOZ_ASSERT(info_->isAlwaysInSlot || info_->isLazilyCachedInSlot);
   12123           1 :         return info_->slotIndex;
   12124             :     }

   12126           1 :         return info_->isLazilyCachedInSlot;

   12128           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   12129           1 :         if (!ins->isGetDOMProperty())
   12130             :             return false;
   12131             : 
   12132           1 :         return congruentTo(ins->toGetDOMProperty());
   12133             :     }
   12134             : 
   12135           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MGetDOMProperty* ins) const {
   12136           1 :         if (!isDomMovable())
   12137             :             return false;

   12139             :         // Checking the jitinfo is the same as checking the constant function
   12140           1 :         if (!(info() == ins->info()))
   12141             :             return false;
   12142             : 
   12143           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
   12144             :     }
   12145             : 
   12146           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   12147           1 :         JSJitInfo::AliasSet aliasSet = domAliasSet();
   12148           1 :         if (aliasSet == JSJitInfo::AliasNone)
   12149             :             return AliasSet::None();
   12150           1 :         if (aliasSet == JSJitInfo::AliasDOMSets)
   12151             :             return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::DOMProperty);
   12152             :         MOZ_ASSERT(aliasSet == JSJitInfo::AliasEverything);
   12153             :         return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::Any);
   12154             :     }
   12155             : 
   12156           1 :     bool possiblyCalls() const override {
   12157           1 :         return true;
   12158             :     }
   12159             : };
   12160             :
