   12505             : // Test whether the index is in the array bounds or a hole.
   12506             : class MInArray
   12507             :   : public MQuaternaryInstruction,
   12508             :     public ObjectPolicy<3>::Data
   12509             : {
   12510             :     bool needsHoleCheck_;
   12511             :     bool needsNegativeIntCheck_;
   12512             :     JSValueType unboxedType_;
   12513             : 
   12514             :     MInArray(MDefinition* elements, MDefinition* index,
   12515             :              MDefinition* initLength, MDefinition* object,
   12516             :              bool needsHoleCheck, JSValueType unboxedType)
   12517             :       : MQuaternaryInstruction(elements, index, initLength, object),
   12518             :         needsHoleCheck_(needsHoleCheck),
   12519             :         needsNegativeIntCheck_(true),
   12520           1 :         unboxedType_(unboxedType)
   12521             :     {
   12522           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Boolean);
   12523           1 :         setMovable();
   12524             :         MOZ_ASSERT(elements->type() == MIRType::Elements);
   12525             :         MOZ_ASSERT(index->type() == MIRType::Int32);
   12526             :         MOZ_ASSERT(initLength->type() == MIRType::Int32);
   12527             :     }
   12528             : 
   12529             :   public:
   12530           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(InArray)
   12531           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
   12532           1 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, elements), (1, index), (2, initLength), (3, object))
   12533             : 
   12534             :     bool needsHoleCheck() const {
   12535             :         return needsHoleCheck_;
   12536             :     }
   12537             :     bool needsNegativeIntCheck() const {
   12538             :         return needsNegativeIntCheck_;
   12539             :     }
   12540             :     JSValueType unboxedType() const {
   12541             :         return unboxedType_;
   12542             :     }
   12543             :     void collectRangeInfoPreTrunc() override;
   12544           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   12545           1 :         return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::Element);
   12546             :     }
   12547           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   12548           1 :         if (!ins->isInArray())
   12549             :             return false;
   12550           1 :         const MInArray* other = ins->toInArray();
   12551           1 :         if (needsHoleCheck() != other->needsHoleCheck())
   12552             :             return false;
   12553           1 :         if (needsNegativeIntCheck() != other->needsNegativeIntCheck())
   12554             :             return false;
   12555           1 :         if (unboxedType() != other->unboxedType())
   12556             :             return false;
   12557           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(other);
   12558             :     }
   12559             : };

   12649             : // This MIR instruction is used to get an argument from the actual arguments.
   12650             : class MGetFrameArgument
   12651             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
   12652             :     public IntPolicy<0>::Data
   12653             : {
   12654             :     bool scriptHasSetArg_;
   12655             : 
   12656           1 :     MGetFrameArgument(MDefinition* idx, bool scriptHasSetArg)
   12657             :       : MUnaryInstruction(idx),
   12658           1 :         scriptHasSetArg_(scriptHasSetArg)
   12659             :     {
   12660           1 :         setResultType(MIRType::Value);
   12661           1 :         setMovable();
   12662           1 :     }

   12665           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(GetFrameArgument)
   12666           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS

   12668             : 
   12669           1 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   12670           1 :         return congruentIfOperandsEqual(ins);
   12671             :     }
   12672           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   12673             :         // If the script doesn't have any JSOP_SETARG ops, then this instruction is never
   12674             :         // aliased.
   12675           1 :         if (scriptHasSetArg_)
   12676             :             return AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::FrameArgument);
   12677             :         return AliasSet::None();
   12678             :     }
   12679             : };

   12817             : // Given a value, guard that the value is in a particular TypeSet, then returns
   12818             : // that value.
   12819           0 : class MTypeBarrier
   12820             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
   12821             :     public TypeBarrierPolicy::Data
   12822             : {
   12823             :     BarrierKind barrierKind_;
   12824             : 
   12825           1 :     MTypeBarrier(MDefinition* def, TemporaryTypeSet* types,
   12826             :                  BarrierKind kind = BarrierKind::TypeSet)
   12827             :       : MUnaryInstruction(def),
   12828           1 :         barrierKind_(kind)
   12829             :     {
   12830             :         MOZ_ASSERT(kind == BarrierKind::TypeTagOnly || kind == BarrierKind::TypeSet);
   12831             : 
   12832             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!types->unknown());

   12834           1 :         setResultTypeSet(types);

   12854             :         return barrierKind_;
   12855             :     }
   12856             :     MDefinition* foldsTo(TempAllocator& alloc) override;
   12857             : 
   12858           1 :     bool alwaysBails() const {
   12859             :         // If mirtype of input doesn't agree with mirtype of barrier,
   12860             :         // we will definitely bail.
   12861           1 :         MIRType type = resultTypeSet()->getKnownMIRType();
   12862           1 :         if (type == MIRType::Value)
   12863             :             return false;
   12864           1 :         if (input()->type() == MIRType::Value)
   12865             :             return false;
   12866           1 :         if (input()->type() == MIRType::ObjectOrNull) {
   12867             :             // The ObjectOrNull optimization is only performed when the
   12868             :             // barrier's type is MIRType::Null.
   12869             :             MOZ_ASSERT(type == MIRType::Null);
   12870             :             return false;
   12871             :         }
   12872           1 :         return input()->type() != type;
   12873             :     }
   12874             : 
   12875           0 :     ALLOW_CLONE(MTypeBarrier)
   12876             : };

   13105             : // This is an element of a spaghetti stack which is used to represent the memory
   13106             : // context which has to be restored in case of a bailout.
   13107             : struct MStoreToRecover : public TempObject, public InlineSpaghettiStackNode<MStoreToRecover>
   13108             : {

   13112           1 :       : operand(operand)
   13113             :     { }
   13114             : };
   13115             : 
   13116             : typedef InlineSpaghettiStack<MStoreToRecover> MStoresToRecoverList;
   13117             : 
   13118             : // A resume point contains the information needed to reconstruct the Baseline
   13119             : // state from a position in the JIT. See the big comment near resumeAfter() in
   13120             : // IonBuilder.cpp.
   13121             : class MResumePoint final :
   13122             :   public MNode
   13123             : #ifdef DEBUG
   13124             :   , public InlineForwardListNode<MResumePoint>
   13125             : #endif
   13126             : {
   13127             :   public:
   13128             :     enum Mode {
   13129             :         ResumeAt,    // Resume until before the current instruction
   13130             :         ResumeAfter, // Resume after the current instruction
   13131             :         Outer        // State before inlining.
   13132             :     };
   13133             : 
   13134             :   private:
   13135             :     friend class MBasicBlock;
   13136             :     friend void AssertBasicGraphCoherency(MIRGraph& graph, bool force);
   13137             : 
   13138             :     // List of stack slots needed to reconstruct the frame corresponding to the
   13139             :     // function which is compiled by IonBuilder.
   13140             :     FixedList<MUse> operands_;
   13141             : 
   13142             :     // List of stores needed to reconstruct the content of objects which are
   13143             :     // emulated by EmulateStateOf variants.
   13144             :     MStoresToRecoverList stores_;
   13145             : 
   13146             :     jsbytecode* pc_;
   13147             :     MInstruction* instruction_;
   13148             :     Mode mode_;
   13149             : 
   13150             :     MResumePoint(MBasicBlock* block, jsbytecode* pc, Mode mode);
   13151             :     void inherit(MBasicBlock* state);
   13152             : 
   13153             :   protected:
   13154             :     // Initializes operands_ to an empty array of a fixed length.
   13155             :     // The array may then be filled in by inherit().
   13156             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool init(TempAllocator& alloc);
   13157             : 
   13158             :     void clearOperand(size_t index) {
   13159             :         // FixedList doesn't initialize its elements, so do an unchecked init.
   13160           1 :         operands_[index].initUncheckedWithoutProducer(this);
   13161             :     }
   13162             : 
   13163           1 :     MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) override {
   13164           1 :         return &operands_[index];
   13165             :     }
   13166           1 :     const MUse* getUseFor(size_t index) const override {
   13167           1 :         return &operands_[index];
   13168             :     }
   13169             : 
   13170             :   public:
   13171             :     static MResumePoint* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MBasicBlock* block, jsbytecode* pc,
   13172             :                              Mode mode);
   13173             :     static MResumePoint* New(TempAllocator& alloc, MBasicBlock* block, MResumePoint* model,
   13174             :                              const MDefinitionVector& operands);
   13175             :     static MResumePoint* Copy(TempAllocator& alloc, MResumePoint* src);
   13176             : 
   13177           1 :     MNode::Kind kind() const override {
   13178           1 :         return MNode::ResumePoint;
   13179             :     }
   13180             :     size_t numAllocatedOperands() const {
   13181           1 :         return operands_.length();
   13182             :     }
   13183             :     uint32_t stackDepth() const {
   13184           1 :         return numAllocatedOperands();
   13185             :     }
   13186           1 :     size_t numOperands() const override {
   13187           1 :         return numAllocatedOperands();
   13188             :     }
   13189           0 :     size_t indexOf(const MUse* u) const final override {
   13190             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u >= &operands_[0]);
   13191             :         MOZ_ASSERT(u <= &operands_[numOperands() - 1]);
   13192           1 :         return u - &operands_[0];
   13193             :     }
   13194             :     void initOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) {
   13195             :         // FixedList doesn't initialize its elements, so do an unchecked init.
   13196           1 :         operands_[index].initUnchecked(operand, this);
   13197             :     }
   13198           0 :     void replaceOperand(size_t index, MDefinition* operand) final override {
   13199           1 :         operands_[index].replaceProducer(operand);
   13200           0 :     }
   13201             : 
   13202             :     bool isObservableOperand(MUse* u) const;
   13203             :     bool isObservableOperand(size_t index) const;
   13204             :     bool isRecoverableOperand(MUse* u) const;
   13205             : 
   13206           1 :     MDefinition* getOperand(size_t index) const override {
   13207           1 :         return operands_[index].producer();
   13208             :     }
   13209             :     jsbytecode* pc() const {
   13210             :         return pc_;
   13211             :     }
   13212             :     MResumePoint* caller() const;
   13213             :     uint32_t frameCount() const {
   13214             :         uint32_t count = 1;
   13215             :         for (MResumePoint* it = caller(); it; it = it->caller())
   13216             :             count++;
   13217             :         return count;
   13218             :     }
   13219             :     MInstruction* instruction() {
   13220             :         return instruction_;
   13221             :     }
   13222             :     void setInstruction(MInstruction* ins) {
   13223             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!instruction_);
   13224           1 :         instruction_ = ins;
   13225             :     }
   13226             :     // Only to be used by stealResumePoint.
   13227             :     void replaceInstruction(MInstruction* ins) {
   13228             :         MOZ_ASSERT(instruction_);
   13229           0 :         instruction_ = ins;
   13230             :     }
   13231             :     void resetInstruction() {
   13232             :         MOZ_ASSERT(instruction_);
   13233           1 :         instruction_ = nullptr;
   13234             :     }
   13235             :     Mode mode() const {
   13236             :         return mode_;
   13237             :     }
   13238             : 
   13239           1 :     void releaseUses() {
   13240           1 :         for (size_t i = 0, e = numOperands(); i < e; i++) {
   13241           1 :             if (operands_[i].hasProducer())
   13242           1 :                 operands_[i].releaseProducer();
   13243             :         }
   13244           1 :     }
   13245             : 
   13246             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool writeRecoverData(CompactBufferWriter& writer) const override;
   13247             : 
   13248             :     // Register a store instruction on the current resume point. This
   13249             :     // instruction would be recovered when we are bailing out. The |cache|
   13250             :     // argument can be any resume point, it is used to share memory if we are
   13251             :     // doing the same modification.
   13252             :     void addStore(TempAllocator& alloc, MDefinition* store, const MResumePoint* cache = nullptr);
   13253             : 
   13254             :     MStoresToRecoverList::iterator storesBegin() const {
   13255           1 :         return stores_.begin();
   13256             :     }
   13257             :     MStoresToRecoverList::iterator storesEnd() const {
   13258           1 :         return stores_.end();
   13259             :     }
   13260             : 
   13261             :     virtual void dump(GenericPrinter& out) const override;
   13262             :     virtual void dump() const override;
   13263             : };

   13384             : 
   13385             : // Increase the warm-up counter of the provided script upon execution and test if
   13386             : // the warm-up counter surpasses the threshold. Upon hit it will recompile the
   13387             : // outermost script (i.e. not the inlined script).
   13388             : class MRecompileCheck : public MNullaryInstruction
   13389             : {
   13390             :   public:
   13391             :     enum RecompileCheckType {
   13392             :         RecompileCheck_OptimizationLevel,
   13393             :         RecompileCheck_Inlining
   13394             :     };
   13395             : 
   13396             :   private:
   13397             :     JSScript* script_;
   13398             :     uint32_t recompileThreshold_;
   13399             :     bool forceRecompilation_;
   13400             :     bool increaseWarmUpCounter_;
   13401             : 
   13402           1 :     MRecompileCheck(JSScript* script, uint32_t recompileThreshold, RecompileCheckType type)
   13403             :       : script_(script),
   13404           1 :         recompileThreshold_(recompileThreshold)
   13405             :     {
   13406           1 :         switch (type) {
   13407             :           case RecompileCheck_OptimizationLevel:
   13408           0 :             forceRecompilation_ = false;
   13409           0 :             increaseWarmUpCounter_ = true;
   13410           0 :             break;
   13411             :           case RecompileCheck_Inlining:
   13412           1 :             forceRecompilation_ = true;
   13413           1 :             increaseWarmUpCounter_ = false;
   13414           1 :             break;
   13415             :           default:
   13416           0 :             MOZ_CRASH("Unexpected recompile check type");
   13417             :         }
   13418             : 
   13419           1 :         setGuard();
   13420           1 :     }
   13421             : 
   13422             :   public:
   13423           1 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(RecompileCheck)
   13424           1 :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
   13425             : 
   13426             :     JSScript* script() const {
   13427             :         return script_;
   13428             :     }
   13429             : 
   13430             :     uint32_t recompileThreshold() const {
   13431             :         return recompileThreshold_;
   13432             :     }
   13433             : 
   13434             :     bool forceRecompilation() const {
   13435             :         return forceRecompilation_;
   13436             :     }
   13437             : 
   13438             :     bool increaseWarmUpCounter() const {
   13439             :         return increaseWarmUpCounter_;
   13440             :     }
   13441             : 
   13442           1 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   13443           1 :         return AliasSet::None();
   13444             :     }
   13445             : };

   13730             : class MWasmLoadTls
   13731             :   : public MUnaryInstruction,
   13732             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
   13733             : {
   13734             :     uint32_t offset_;
   13735             :     AliasSet aliases_;
   13736             : 
   13737             :     explicit MWasmLoadTls(MDefinition* tlsPointer, uint32_t offset, MIRType type, AliasSet aliases)
   13738             :       : MUnaryInstruction(tlsPointer),
   13739             :         offset_(offset),
   13740             :         aliases_(aliases)
   13741             :     {
   13742             :         // Different Tls data have different alias classes and only those classes are allowed.
   13743             :         MOZ_ASSERT(aliases_.flags() == AliasSet::Load(AliasSet::WasmHeapMeta).flags() ||
   13744             :                    aliases_.flags() == AliasSet::None().flags());
   13745             : 
   13746             :         // The only types supported at the moment.
   13747             :         MOZ_ASSERT(type == MIRType::Pointer || type == MIRType::Int32);
   13748             : 
   13749             :         setMovable();
   13750             :         setResultType(type);
   13751             :     }
   13752             : 
   13753             :   public:
   13754           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(WasmLoadTls)
   13755             :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
   13756             :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, tlsPtr))
   13757             : 
   13758             :     uint32_t offset() const {
   13759             :         return offset_;
   13760             :     }
   13761             : 
   13762           0 :     bool congruentTo(const MDefinition* ins) const override {
   13763           0 :         return op() == ins->op() &&
   13764           0 :                offset() == ins->toWasmLoadTls()->offset() &&
   13765           0 :                type() == ins->type();
   13766             :     }
   13767             : 
   13768           0 :     HashNumber valueHash() const override {
   13769           0 :         return op() + offset();
   13770             :     }
   13771             : 
   13772           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   13773           0 :         return aliases_;
   13774             :     }
   13775             : };
   13776             : 
   13777             : class MWasmBoundsCheck
   13778             :   : public MBinaryInstruction,
   13779             :     public NoTypePolicy::Data
   13780             : {
   13781             :     wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset_;
   13782             :

   13785             :       : MBinaryInstruction(index, boundsCheckLimit),
   13786             :         bytecodeOffset_(bytecodeOffset)
   13787             :     {
   13788             :         // Bounds check is effectful: it throws for OOB.
   13789             :         setGuard();
   13790             :     }
   13791             : 
   13792             :   public:
   13793           0 :     INSTRUCTION_HEADER(WasmBoundsCheck)
   13794             :     TRIVIAL_NEW_WRAPPERS
   13795           0 :     NAMED_OPERANDS((0, index), (1, boundsCheckLimit))
   13796             : 
   13797           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   13798           0 :         return AliasSet::None();
   13799             :     }
   13800             : 
   13801             :     bool isRedundant() const {
   13802             :         return !isGuard();
   13803             :     }
   13804             : 
   13805             :     void setRedundant() {
   13806           0 :         setNotGuard();
   13807             :     }
   13808             : 
   13809             :     wasm::BytecodeOffset bytecodeOffset() const {
   13810             :         return bytecodeOffset_;
   13811             :     }
   13812             : };
   13813             :

   13887           0 :     AliasSet getAliasSet() const override {
   13888             :         // When a barrier is needed, make the instruction effectful by giving
   13889             :         // it a "store" effect.
   13890           0 :         if (access_.isAtomic())
   13891             :             return AliasSet::Store(AliasSet::WasmHeap);

   13893             :     }
